0.title: Details of BCCI's non-cricket expenditure of ₹22 crore in last 2 years surface
0.article_body: The BCCI tabled the break-up of its non-cricket expenditure in the last two years at the apex council meeting. The non-cricket expenditure added up to ₹22 crore, including ₹18 crore for Olympic expenses. The BCCI paid ₹70 lakh to singer Mohit Chauhan for India's official theme song for Tokyo Olympics. The BCCI spent ₹98 lakh for Olympics campaign T-shirts.

1.title: Model Arpita, aide of WB minister Partha, arrested after ₹20cr found at her home
1.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday arrested model and actress Arpita Mukherjee, a close aide of arrested West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. This came a day after the agency said it found ₹20 crore from her residence during raids in connection to the state's School Service Commission (SSC) teacher recruitment scam. Chatterjee was sent to two days of ED custody.

2.title: S Korea to lift its decades-long ban on N Korean newspapers, TV shows
2.article_body: A South Korean official on Friday said that South Korea plans to lift its decades-long ban on public access to North Korean TV shows, newspapers and other publications. The move is part of its efforts to promote mutual understanding between the rivals, the official added. Notably, this comes despite tensions between the two countries over North Korea's recent missile tests.

3.title: Alcaraz will be much better player than me but Nadal is a big word: Ferrer
3.article_body: Ex-world number three David Ferrer said his Spanish compatriot Carlos Alcaraz is a great player, adding he's going to reach number one and win Grand Slams. On comparisons between Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal, Ferrer said that 22-time Grand Slam champion is a "big word". Ferrer further said that the 19-year-old will undoubtedly be a much better tennis player than him.

4.title: UP Police distribute helmets to Kanwariyas on bikes in GB Nagar
4.article_body: The police deployed on Kanwar Yatra duty in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar have distributed helmets and national flags to Kanwariyas on two-wheelers. The police have also set up a control room in Noida to facilitate the movement of Kanwariyas through the city. Police personnel have been instructed to immediately help the devotees in case of any problems, an official said.

5.title: Mulund residents file police complaint against property developer
5.article_body: Residents of Tirumala Habitats in Mumbai's Mulund suburb have filed a police complaint against the 40-storey building's property developer, alleging poor conditions of basic facilities. Tirumala Habitats has 415 flats, ranging from ₹2.25 crore to ₹5.5 crore. Residents said the electric work is done poorly, the lift often malfunctions and safety glasses are missing on higher floors.

6.title: President Ram Nath Kovind delivers farewell speech in Parliament
6.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, whose term is set to end on Saturday, addressed the Parliament for the last time as he was given a farewell. He recalled the key moments of his five-year tenure and also congratulated his successor and President-elect Droupadi Murmu on winning the election. Murmu will take oath as the President of India on Monday.

7.title: 4-year-old girl raped by 22-year-old man in UP village: Police
7.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 22-year-old man named Farid in a village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday night, police said. According to police complaint, the girl was playing outside her house when the accused lured her and took her to a secluded place, where he raped her. The girl is said to be in a critical condition.

8.title: I'd called him days before death, we couldn't talk: Sidharth's cousin Aditya
8.article_body: Late actor Sidharth Shukla's cousin actor Aditya Shukla has revealed that he called the former days before his death. "I had called him but he was busy with his work so we couldn't talk. I wish we had spoken that day," Aditya said. He further said that he was inspired to join the industry after looking at Sidharth's career.

9.title: Kejriwal to visit HP to administer oath to over 5,000 AAP workers
9.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal will visit Himachal Pradesh on Monday to administer oath to more than 5,000 officer bearers of AAP in Solan, ANI reported. Kejriwal will be accompanied by Punjab CM and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann. This comes ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Earlier, AAP organised a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Palampur.

10.title: 13-yr-old girl abducted, raped in Chhattisgarh; 3 arrested
10.article_body: Three people, including a minor, have been arrested after a 13-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped in Chhattisgarh's Korea district. According to police, the minor boy abducted the girl on July 11 and raped her. Later, on July 14, he along with the other two accused took the girl to a godown and raped her, an officer said.

11.title: See you in court of law & court of people: Irani to Congress over allegations on daughter
11.article_body: Hitting out at Congress for allegations against her daughter Zoish, Smriti Irani said, "Her character was publicly mutilated by Congress spokespeople." She called the allegations against Zoish "malicious" and said, "I'll see you (Congress leaders) in the court of law and in the court of people." Congress earlier held a press conference alleging Zoish's restaurant had an illegal bar license.

12.title: We have to be grateful for push for diversity in Hollywood: Farhan
12.article_body: Farhan Akhtar stated that we have to be "very grateful" for the push for diversity happening within storytelling in Hollywood. "How many actors or people from India were working in other parts of the world 10 or 15 years ago? That has changed...Irrfan...Om Puri...Priyanka (Chopra) is doing exceedingly well and Alia (Bhatt) is also doing a film now," he said.

13.title: Ghaziabad Police busts NCR gang accused of stealing 300 vehicles
13.article_body: Four members of an inter-state vehicle robbery gang suspected of stealing over 300 cars, motorcycles etc. from the Delhi-NCR region were arrested by Ghaziabad Police on Thursday. The gang's leader was arrested from Hint Crossroad in Kavinagar, police said. Based on his interrogation, Ghaziabad Police raided a godown in Sonepat and arrested three other accused, police added.

14.title: India Women should take no team lightly at CWG 2022: Anjum Chopra
14.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra has said India Women should take no team lightly at Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, adding all teams are great. She further said, "In T20I and 50-over format, the key difference is that anyone can have a good day." India will face Australia in their first match of Group A on July 29.

15.title: Irani denies 'illegal' Goa bar is run by daughter, says 'she's a college student'
15.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday denied claims that her 18-year-old daughter Zoish was running a restaurant with an alleged illegal bar license. Irani said her daughter is leading life as an "ordinary college student", adding, "Her only fault is that her mother fought elections against Rahul Gandhi from Amethi." She said her daughter's "character was assassinated by Congressmen".

16.title: Yeida allots 37 plots in Medical Devices Park in Greater Noida
16.article_body: The Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (Yeida) on Friday allotted plots to 37 medical device manufacturers through a lottery in its upcoming Medical Devices Park in Greater Noida Sector 28. Yeida will earn revenues worth ₹50.08 crore from the sale of these plots, the authority said. According to Yeida, 39 companies qualified for the draw after scrutiny of 173 applicants.

17.title: Angry villagers in K'taka make buffalo inaugurate bus shelter
17.article_body: Upset with the authorities for not restoring the village's old collapsed bus shelter, locals in Karnataka's Balehosur built a temporary one with coconut fronds. In protest, they made a buffalo inaugurate it instead of a politician. "It's been two years, we've been requesting the local MLA and MP to restore the bus shelter...but nothing was ever done," the villagers alleged.

18.title: Russian airstrikes on Odesa after grain deal outrageous: US envoy
18.article_body: Russia should be held to account for the "outrageous" airstrikes on the Ukrainian port city of Odesa on Saturday, the US ambassador to Kyiv, Bridget Brink, said. The strikes came less than 24 hours after Russia and Ukraine signed a deal to reopen Black Sea ports and resume grain exports. The Kremlin is continuing to "weaponise food", Brink added.

19.title: Will Sisodia too lose memory?: Anurag amid row over Delhi Excise Policy
19.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of shielding the "corrupt" after LG VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Delhi Excise Policy. "There were allegations against Satyendar Jain who lost his memory in jail. Will Manish Sisodia too lose memory?" Thakur stated. "AAP government has set new records of corruption," he further said.

20.title: Don't want to be construed as somebody who misuses surname: Arjun Kapoor
20.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said he doesn't want to be construed as somebody who misuses his surname or his lineage. "I'll not disown where I'm from but I'll never misuse it," he added. "I'm somebody who's very, very aware that I'm blessed. And, I'll never, ever misuse it to put somebody down or take somebody else's opportunity away," said Arjun.

21.title: Man held for cheating people on pretext of real estate business in Hyd
21.article_body: The Cyber Crimes division of Rachakonda Police arrested 38-year-old Salavadi Nagaraju for allegedly cheating people on pretext of real estate business, police tweeted on Saturday. A complaint was registered by a Hyderabad resident, who was allegedly cheated of over ₹52,000 by Nagaraju, who claimed to sell a property. A total of 15 cases have been registered against Nagaraju, police said.

22.title: B'luru woman shares video of road with '40 potholes in 200 m stretch'
22.article_body: A video showing a biker riding through multiple potholes on a road in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media. Describing it as an off-roading experience in the city, Twitter user Ankita Banerjee claimed that the 200 m stretch of road has 40 potholes. Reportedly, the video is of a road near Spice Garden Layout at Marathahalli in the city.

23.title: Video shows sinkhole opening under swimming pool that killed a man during party in Israel
23.article_body: A video of the moment a massive sinkhole opened up underneath a swimming pool in Israel during a party, that left a man dead, has surfaced online. Footage showed the hole suddenly appearing and the water receding. The body of the 32-year-old man was discovered hours later at the bottom of the 43-foot-deep hole, said officials.

24.title: Paparazzi call male celebs 'sir', female celebs by name: Tara Sutaria
24.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria stated that a lot of paparazzi videos show them addressing male celebrities as 'sir' and female celebrities by their name. "We're all very young, we don't want to be called 'ma'am' or 'ji'...but it's this general sense of 'the man...must be given more respect'," she said. Tara added that changing small things like these "could move mountains".

25.title: Dialect coach for 'Good...' made me practice 'Lagawelu Jab Lipastic': Janhvi
25.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor has said her dialect coach made her practice the Bhojpuri song 'Lagawelu Jab Lipastic' during her training for 'Good Luck Jerry'. "[It's] an amazing song," she added. "People of Bihar are real fun and their way of talking has a certain...sweetness to it," said Janhvi, who plays the role of a girl from Bihar in the upcoming film.

26.title: Angelina wins legal battle against ex-husband Brad over French winery
26.article_body: Actress Angelina Jolie has won the legal battle against her ex-husband actor Brad Pitt over the Chateau Miraval winery where they got married. They had bought the winery in 2008 for an estimated $28.3 million. Brad filed the case claiming they had agreed not to sell their interests in the company but Angelina sold it to the Stoli Group.

27.title: Monarch butterfly added to international list of threatened species
27.article_body: The migratory black and orange monarch butterfly has been placed in the endangered category of the International Union for Conservation of Nature's Red List of Threatened Species. The butterfly is threatened with extinction because of habitat destruction and climate change, conservationists said on Thursday. Planet Earth is currently undergoing sixth mass extinction driven by human activity.

28.title: IMD predicts moderate to heavy rainfall in Hyd, yellow alert issued
28.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for moderate to heavy rainfall in the next 48 hours in Hyderabad and parts of Telangana. Hyderabad Traffic Police urged people to stay indoors as due to water logging, there is a possibility of heavy traffic congestion. GHMC and Disaster Response Force (DRF) personnel have been deployed on ground.

29.title: Flash floods kill at least 17 peo­ple in south­ern Iran, 6 missing
29.article_body: At least 17 people have died and six others are missing after heavy rains caused flooding in Iran's southern province of Fars, state television said on Saturday. About 55 people were rescued in the flood which submerged 15 cars, officials added. The country's metrology department had warned about heavy seasonal rainfall across Iran, which is facing a decades-long drought.

30.title: Saudi Police arrests man who helped Jewish reporter sneak into Mecca
30.article_body: The police in Saudi Arabia said that they have arrested a Saudi man who helped an Israeli-Jewish reporter sneak into Mecca in explicit violation of regulations prohibiting the entry of non-Muslims. Gil Tamary had filmed himself in Mecca for a roughly 10-minute-long segment that aired on Monday in which he visited a key site on the hajj pilgrimage route.

31.title: Superb my superhero friend: Suniel on Ajay's National Award
31.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to Twitter on Saturday to congratulate Ajay Devgn on winning the Best Actor National Award for the film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "AJ! Superb show my superhero friend. You kept your word to celebrate our unsung heroes even more proudly," he wrote. "Congrats on the National Award for #Tanhaji," Suniel added with the hashtag "Proud".

32.title: Man hit by local train at Mumbai's Kandivali station, dies
32.article_body: A man died after being hit by a local train at Mumbai's Kandivali station, an official from the Government Railway Police (GRP) said on Friday. "We're trying to establish the victim's identity...[and] track...two others who were seen accompanying him in the CCTV footage," the official said. The victim was critically wounded and died at a hospital, the official added.

33.title: Working on getting Olympics back to London: Mayor Sadiq Khan
33.article_body: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has said that his office is working on the city to get a chance to host the Olympic Games again. "The great thing about London is you don't expend carbon on building new stadiums...because we've got all the kit," Khan said. He added that the plan is in the early stages and would require government support.

34.title: Andhra gets a new floating solar power plant on Meghadri Gedda reservoir
34.article_body: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation has commissioned a floating solar power plant at Meghadri Gedda reservoir in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. G Lakshmisha, Commissioner of GVMC, said that the power plant can produce 4.2 million units of power each year. "Besides that, we're also saving 54,000 tonnes of coal per year and reducing emissions by 3,022 tonnes per year," he added.

35.title: BMC to distribute 50 lakh national flags under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
35.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to distribute 50 lakh national flags to residents and institutions in Mumbai, as part of the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Free distribution of flags is meant to encourage better response, a BMC official said. The BMC has also decided to have a laser show from August 13 to 15 at Marine Drive.

36.title: Mark Cuban reveals his worst Shark Tank investment, says 'all of the money is gone'
36.article_body: Billionaire Mark Cuban recently revealed that the worst investment deal he made on 'Shark Tank' was Breathometer. Cuban invested in the smartphone breathalyser after Charles Michael Yim pitched the idea in 2013. "I'd look at [Yim's] Instagram and he'd be in Bora Bora...Two weeks later, he'd be in Vegas...Next thing you know, all of the money is gone," Cuban said.

37.title: China releases high-resolution pic of Mars' largest moon Phobos that looks like a potato
37.article_body: China released a high-resolution image of Mars' largest moon Phobos on Saturday, marking the two-year anniversary of the launch of its Mars probe Tianwen-1. In the picture, Phobos can be seen as an irregularly shaped object like a potato. Öpik, an impact crater on Phobos named after Estonian astronomer and astrophysicist Ernst Öpik, can also be seen.

38.title: Passengers jump out as train catches fire over river in US, videos surface
38.article_body: Several videos of people jumping out of a train that caught fire on a bridge in the US have surfaced online. Passengers of a Boston Orange Line train were seen smashing windows to jump out on the tracks after a massive fire that broke out over the Mystic River in Massachusetts on Thursday (July 21). The train had 200 passengers.

39.title: That's my most favourite thing in the world: Ranbir on if he procrastinates
39.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor in an interview was asked if he procrastinates, to which the actor replied, "That's my most favourite thing in the world, just to sit and think about nothing." Ranbir currently stars in 'Shamshera', an action-adventure film directed by Karan Malhotra. He will next be seen in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

40.title: Wife called and was bawling, I started crying too: Siddharth on National Award
40.article_body: Actor Siddharth Menon said that his wife called him after he won a National Award. "She called me and started crying. She was bawling. I couldn't resist and I cried as well. If she cries, I lose it. She is the one, who has seen me so closely through the process of making this film," he added.

41.title: Really well done epic, very powerful story: 'Avengers...' co-maker on RRR
41.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo, who is a co-director of 'Avengers: Endgame', said, "'RRR' was a [really] well done epic, (with) nice strong themes [and] great visuals." "[It] was a great movie...and [had] a really powerful story about brotherhood," added Joe. Discussing 'RRR', 'Piranha' director Joe Dante had said, "There's [never] been a more brutal portrait of the horrors of British colonisation."

42.title: I don't have the audacity: Janhvi on picking a Sridevi film for remake
42.article_body: Talking about a film starring her late mother and actress Sridevi which she'd pick for a remake, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "I don't have the audacity to pick any of her films and be in a remake." "What she...[did] in each of her films is fully untouchable," she added. "[My life with mom around] was a fantasy," Janhvi had stated.

43.title: TMC has emerged as party of thieves under Mamata's leadership: BJP MP
43.article_body: BJP MP and Vice President of party's West Bengal unit Saumitra Khan on Saturday criticised CM Mamata Banerjee over the arrest of minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. "Tomorrow Firhad Hakim will be arrested, then Abhishek Banerjee," Khan stated. "TMC has emerged as...party of thieves and scamsters under the leadership of Mamata Banerjee," he added.

44.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad civic body hires transgender persons as security guards
44.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has recruited over 30 transgender persons as security guards and green marshals. "We are hopeful that this opportunity will certainly help them in creating their own identity and live with dignity," Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil said. "We also have plans to empower the transgender community members by providing financial support to them," he added.

45.title: 7 days after retirement, US sprinter Felix called back at World Championships
45.article_body: Seven days after retirement, US sprinter Allyson Felix has been called back at World Championships to race in the preliminaries of the women's 4×400 relay on Saturday in Oregon. The seven-time Olympic gold medallist ran in what she had said was her last major race on July 15, helping US win a bronze medal in the mixed relay.

46.title: UP man kills 5-yr-old niece for demanding mango while he was eating
46.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly killing his five-year-old niece for repeatedly demanding a mango while he ate his meal. Reportedly, the accused panicked and slit the girl's throat when she started bleeding after he hit her with a rod. The body of the deceased, who'd gone missing on Tuesday afternoon, was found at the accused's home later at night.

47.title: Climate crisis threatens 70% marine life in biodiversity-rich areas: Experts
47.article_body: Over 70% of marine life in the most biodiversity-rich areas of Earth's ocean is threatened by climate change, experts said. "Research shows that locations with exceptionally high marine biodiversity are...most exposed to future oceanic warming," said Dr Stuart Brown. "This is because species living in these...regions are generally ill-equipped to respond to large changes in temperature," he added.

48.title: Video of B'luru parents driving on footpaths goes viral, police react
48.article_body: A video of parents driving two-wheelers with their children riding pillion on footpaths to avoid traffic in Bengaluru has gone viral. The video was reportedly shot at St Patrick's Complex. Reacting to it, Ashoknagar Traffic Police Station tweeted, "[We've informed] the sector officer and patrolling CoBRA to take action against violators." A netizen said, "Sad…teaching the kids wrong things."

49.title: 1st segment of Pune's 3rd Metro line erected at Hinjewadi
49.article_body: The first segment of Pune's third Metro line, being developed by the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority, was erected at Hinjewadi on Friday. The segment weighs 46 tonnes and is erected at a height of 11 metres between proposed station number 01 and 02 on the 23-kilometre elevated Hinjewadi-Shivajinagar line. "Around 10-12 such segments...used between two pillars," an official said.

50.title: US bans ex-Paraguay President Cartes from entering the country
50.article_body: The US has imposed a travel ban on Paraguay's ex-President Horacio Cartes, accusing him of corruption and links to "terrorist" groups. Cartes, who served as President from 2013 to 2018, had "obstructed a major international probe into transnational crime in order to protect himself and his criminal associate from potential prosecution and political damage," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said.

51.title: Putin's spit into the face of UN chief, Turkish Prez: Ukraine on Russia's missile attack
51.article_body: Russia attacked Odesa sea port less than 24 hours after signing an agreement aimed at restarting Ukrainian grain exports from Odesa and two other Black Sea locations. After the attack, Ukraine said the missile strike was "Vladimir Putin's spit into the face" of UN chief António Guterres and Turkish President Recep Erdogan, "who put enormous efforts into reaching the accord".

52.title: SpaceX breaks its annual record with 32nd rocket launch of 2022
52.article_body: Elon Musk’s SpaceX on Friday broke its record for the number of rockets launched in a year. While the company managed 31 launches in 2021, it aims to launch 52 missions in 2022. SpaceX's 32nd launch of 2022 on Friday deployed 46 Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit. Notably, SpaceX so far has launched nearly 3,000 Starlink satellites to space.

53.title: People ask 'Why is she in the film?': Vaani Kapoor on 'Shamshera'
53.article_body: Talking about actor Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera' which released yesterday, actress Vaani Kapoor who stars in the film said, "[People] ask, 'Why is she in this film?'" "People want to know my credibility," added Vaani. "Opportunities [didn't] knock on my door. [Yet], people said, 'She is lucky!'" she stated. "I am the underdog...I am trying to prove who I'm," she said.

54.title: Father catches man who snatched daughter's gold chain in Chandigarh
54.article_body: A father caught a man who snatched his seven-year-old daughter's gold locket after an about 100-metre chase in Chandigarh. "My daughter was crying and all I could think of was getting her locket back," the father said. The father handed over the accused to the police after informing them. The locket was recovered from the pocket of the accused's trousers.

55.title: I wanted them to hit me over the covers: Chahal on 1st ODI vs WI
55.article_body: Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he wanted the West Indies batters to hit him over the covers in the first ODI. "I was...bowling wider because the leg-side boundary was small," added Chahal. Talking about the last over where Mohammed Siraj defended 15 runs, Chahal stated, "There was confidence...but also pressure...When Sanju Samson made that save...it raised our confidence."

56.title: Anti-encroachment drive on land worth ₹40 cr conducted in Greater Noida
56.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) conducted an anti-encroachment drive against illegal constructions in Sunpura village on Friday on land worth ₹40 crore, officials said. This comes after GNIDA was informed that some people were found building illegal colonies and houses in an area of about 20,000 square metres. "The land lies within GNIDA's notified area," an official said.

57.title: 7 of 19 workers who went missing near China border found
57.article_body: Seven of the 19 construction workers from Assam who went missing near China border in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey district, were found and rescued by an Indian Air Force helicopter, said police on Saturday. They were given food and medicines, said an official. Search is on for the remaining workers, for which an IAF helicopter has been deployed.

58.title: Will try to play all 3 formats for as long as possible: Bairstow
58.article_body: After England all-rounder Ben Stokes announced retirement from ODIs citing difficulties to manage workload, teammate Jonny Bairstow has said that he will try to play all three formats for as long as possible. "I don't see myself making a choice [in the near future]...I'm loving being a part of all three squads. They are all different in themselves," Bairstow said.

59.title: A combination of Ranji winners should be fielded in Irani Cup: Ex-India player
59.article_body: Former cricketer Karsan Ghavri has proposed a combined team that consists of players from 2021-22 and 2019-20 Ranji winning squads, namely Madhya Pradesh and Saurashtra, should be fielded in this year's Irani Cup. "It is only fair that the BCCI picks a...squad consisting [seven players from both sides]," Ghavri said. Notably, the Irani Cup 2019-20 wasn't held due to COVID-19.

60.title: 2 CPI(M) workers held in connection with attack on RSS office in Kerala
60.article_body: Police arrested two CPI(M) workers, aged 23 and 27, in connection with the attack on Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office in Kerala's Payyannur area last week. "As per the preliminary investigation, they both have direct participation in the attack," police said. The incident was caught on CCTV showing several explosions within the boundary wall of the RSS office.

61.title: Centre decides whom to arrest first, then builds 'fake' case: Kejriwal
61.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said there is a new system in India wherein the Centre decides whom to arrest first and then builds a "fake and fabricated" case. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon, possibly in three-four days, Kejriwal claimed. This comes after Delhi LG ordered a CBI probe into alleged violation of Delhi Excise Policy.

62.title: 17-yr-old boy beaten for not chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' in Hyd: Police
62.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was allegedly beaten up in Hyderabad for refusing to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' during a Bonalu (a Hindu festival) procession on Thursday, police said. A group of miscreants had allegedly stopped the victim and told him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' which he refused to do, police added. The victim is a resident of Hussaini Alam.

63.title: I have a 7-month-old baby girl, she spent 15 days in NICU: Sangita Ghosh
63.article_body: Actress Sangita Ghosh, known for portraying Swaran in television show 'Swaran Ghar', has revealed that she has a seven-month-old baby. Sangita said her daughter Devi was born prematurely on December 25 and was in the NICU for around 15 days. "It's not that we hid the news...we decided not to talk about it till...the time was right," the actress added.

64.title: US announces additional $270 million military aid for Ukraine
64.article_body: The US has announced an additional $270 million in military aid to Ukraine. The aid includes four new M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems and 580 Phoenix Ghost drones. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked US President Joe Biden for the package. These "powerful arms will save our soldiers' lives, speed up...liberation of our land from the Russian aggressor", Zelenskyy said.

65.title: Truck loses balance in Nuh amid rains, rams into autorickshaw; 7 dead
65.article_body: Seven people died while four others were injured after a truck allegedly collided with an autorickshaw in Haryana's Nuh on Friday. "It appears that due to heavy rain, the truck lost balance and collided with the auto, which fell into ditch. The truck also lost balance and overturned and fell on top of the auto, which was crushed," police said.

66.title: Tiger survives after being swept away by strong river currents in UP, video goes viral
66.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a tiger surviving strong river currents in Uttar Pradesh. The tiger was swept away by strong currents while trying to cross the Gerua river in Bahraich district. Using its own strength, the tiger managed to swim to the other side and reach the forest of Katarniaghat.

67.title: If you don't like it, don't look at it: Swara Bhasker on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
67.article_body: Swara Bhasker took to Twitter on Friday to write about Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot. "Daily cases of injustice & oppression in India, but sure... our outrage is reserved for Ranveer Singh's photos!" she wrote. "I mean, seriously...don't like it, don't look at it! Not your cup of tea, don't drink it! But don't 'thopo' your preferences on us!" Swara added.

68.title: BCCI to trial BoneXpert software to detect age fraud among cricketers, to cut cost by 80%
68.article_body: The BCCI will use BoneXpert software on an experimental basis to detect age fraud among cricketers with an aim to cut cost by 80%. The BCCI currently uses TW3 method for age determination. The current method costs ₹2,400/bone test and takes about 3-4 days while the proposed usage of BoneXpert software will give instantaneous result and costs only ₹288.

69.title: Someone please make a film on Geeta Dutt and cast me: Sobhita
69.article_body: Actress Sobhita Dhulipala took to Instagram Stories on Friday to appeal filmmakers to cast her in a film made on late playback singer Geeta Dutt. She shared a video montage of the singer's pictures, writing, "Been saying it in every interview since 2016. Geeta Dutt and Amrita Shergil. I am their biggest fan and am nearly possessed by their spirit."

70.title: Bharatpur seer who set self on fire in protest over mining dies
70.article_body: A seer who set himself on fire in Rajasthan's Bharatpur in a protest against mining at certain hills considered sacred by some has died while undergoing treatment in Delhi. The state government had announced earlier that the area will be declared as forest land following the incident. The seer's mortal remains are being taken to Barsana for last rites.

71.title: Kerala fishermen find 28 kg 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in sea
71.article_body: A group of fishermen from Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram who found 28.4 kg of ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in the sea, handed it over to the Kerala Coastal Police. The ambergris was later collected by Kerala Forest Department after police informed them. Ambergris, which is produced in the digestive system of sperm whales, is used to manufacture perfumes.

72.title: Johnny Depp counters Amber Heard's defamation case verdict appeal with his own
72.article_body: A day after Amber Heard filed a notice to appeal the verdict of the defamation case won by Johnny Depp, he filed his own to counter the $2 million he was directed to pay her. Heard's team had filed the notice to appeal the verdict directing her to pay $10 million to Depp by the jury of a Virginia court.

73.title: If we're celebrating Alia-Ranbir, we should celebrate Sushmita-Lalit: Lopamudra
73.article_body: Actress Lopamudra Raut said that it is unfair to be celebrating Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor but not Susmita Sen and Lalit Modi. "No one has the right to comment on her relationship. If we are celebrating Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor or Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh, we should celebrate Sushmita [Sen] and Lalit [Modi] too," she added.

74.title: BJP won more seats under Yediyurappa: Shivakumar after ex-CM vacates seat
74.article_body: After ex-Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa announced his decision to vacate the Shikaripura assembly seat for his son BY Vijayendra, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that the BJP leader should not announce retirement as he "still has political strength". "The BJP has won more seats under his leadership but not with the name of another person," Shivakumar added.

75.title: Use of sub-conventional aerial platforms banned in Delhi ahead of I-Day
75.article_body: Delhi Police have banned flying sub-conventional aerial platforms in the national capital from July 22 to August 16 ahead of Independence Day celebrations. The order bans the use of para-gliders, para-motors, hang-gliders, remotely piloted aircraft, hot air balloons, etc. Anti-social elements or terrorists may pose a threat to citizens' safety by the use of these platforms, police said.

76.title: Woman hires bouncers to abduct her lover in Mumbai for refusing to pay ₹5 lakh
76.article_body: A woman abducted her businessman "lover" in Mumbai by hiring two bouncers after he refused to pay ₹5 lakh demanded by her, police said. The accused allegedly assaulted the victim before abducting and confining him in a Thane-based flat. The victim, a resident of Dombivali, was in a relationship with the woman and used to pay her regularly, police added.

77.title: Eagerly waiting to see how Hindi audience will receive me: Naga on 'Laal...'
77.article_body: Naga Chaitanya, who'll be making his Bollywood debut with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said he's eagerly waiting to see how the Hindi audience will receive him. "I'll...work in Bollywood only if I get acceptance there," he added. Sharing his experience of working with Aamir, Naga said, "It's a dream come true to work with Aamir. He's a wonderful mentor."

78.title: We had confidence Siraj could defend 15 runs in last over: Chahal on 1st ODI
78.article_body: After India won the first ODI against West Indies by three runs in Port of Spain, India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said that the team had confidence that Mohammed Siraj could defend 15 runs in the final over. India scored 308/7 and West Indies managed 305/6 in 50 overs. Siraj posted bowling figures of 10-0-57-2. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

79.title: Man who set ex-wife afire during live stream executed in China
79.article_body: A court in China's Sichuan province on Saturday morning executed a man who was convicted of homicide for setting his former wife on fire. Tang Lu set his ex-wife, Tibetan vlogger Lhamo, on fire on September 14, 2020, when she was live-streaming on Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok. The 30-year-old woman died of her injuries a few weeks later.

80.title: US exploring whether it can send US-made jets to Ukraine: Official
80.article_body: White House spokesman John Kirby on Friday said that the US is exploring whether it can send US-made fighter jets to Ukraine. "It's not something that would be executed in the near-term," he added. Such a move would be a major increase in US support for Ukraine in its battle against Russia, according to Reuters.

81.title: BJP workers protest outside Sisodia's residence against new Liquor Policy
81.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders and workers on Saturday protested outside the residence of Deputy CM Manish Sisodia against the new Liquor Policy of the AAP government. The protesters were detained by police. This comes after Delhi LG VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. Sisodia allegedly made "deliberate and gross procedural lapses".

82.title: People who criticise the govt will be punished: Taliban in new order
82.article_body: Taliban has issued a new order saying that those who criticise "Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan" scholars and public servants, be it with gesture, word or anything else, will be punished. In the order, Taliban leader Mullah Hibatullah Akhundzada said that such actions are considered as "negative propaganda" that "unconsciously helps the enemies".

83.title: Farmers, students protest in B'luru against land acquisition in Devanahalli
83.article_body: The All India Students' Association (AISA) and Fridays For Future (FFF) protested in Bengaluru against the government's plan of acquiring 1,777 acres of fertile agricultural land in Devanahalli. According to reports, about 387 families will be rendered landless if the plan goes ahead. "Industries can be set up on barren land, why is...government after fertile lands?" a student activist said.

84.title: We spend sleepless nights rethinking our verdicts: Chief Justice of India
84.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana has talked about "the responsibility of judging", which he said is "extremely burdensome" and takes a "toll on our mental well-being". He said, "Every litigant enters the courtroom with the expectation of obtaining justice." He added, "We spend sleepless nights rethinking our decisions."

85.title: Wanted to join active politics, but destiny had other plans: CJI Ramana
85.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday revealed that he was keen on joining active politics but destiny had other plans for him. Speaking at an event, he said, "I was born in a village into an agricultural family and English was introduced in Class 7. After BSc, my father encouraged me to study law."

86.title: I hate watching myself on screen, I don't like anything about it: Disha
86.article_body: Actress Disha Patani said in an interview that she "hates" watching herself on screen. "I don't like watching myself. I can't watch myself...I don't like anything about it," she added. Disha further said whenever she watches her films, she covers her eyes most of the time. Disha will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns'.

87.title: Cross-voting in Bihar shows resentment in Oppn: BJP MP on Prez polls
87.article_body: Bihar BJP President and Lok Sabha MP Dr Sanjay Jaiswal said that there is evidence of cross-voting on a "substantial scale" during the Presidential elections in the state. He added that NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu received 133 votes from the state, while their "effective strength...was 125". He claimed that this shows resentment in the Opposition against their leader.

88.title: 3D printing facility now operational at Airport City in Bengaluru
88.article_body: A state-of-the-art 3D printing facility is now operational at the Airport City that is being developed in Bengaluru Airport premises. "This facility will act as a catalyst to help transform our Airport City into a technology hub," Bengaluru Airport City Limited CEO said. "3D printing helps develop a culture of creativity and scope for scaling innovation across industries," he added.

89.title: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan had collapsed while playing cricket
89.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan, who passed away on Saturday morning, had collapsed while playing cricket. "He went to play cricket with his friends in the morning and collapsed on the ground," his co-star Shubhangi Atre told ETimes. He was rushed to a nearby hospital where he was declared dead.

90.title: Mohammad Shami buys Jaguar F-Type sports car worth nearly ₹1 crore, pic surfaces
90.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami has purchased a Jaguar F-Type sports car, which is worth nearly ₹1 crore. Shami's car is the 2.0 Coupe R-Dynamic variant. The car has a 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol engine. In June, Shami had bought a new Royal Enfield Continental GT 650 worth more than ₹3 crore.

91.title: I don't agree, my knees are already gone: Chahal on if cricket should be played in shorts
91.article_body: On being asked whether cricket should be played wearing shorts due to hot weather, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "No, no. I don't agree with that." He added, "We have to take care of our knees whenever we slide, it's very hard. My two knees are already gone, there are many bruises. I think full pants work well for us."

92.title: Heatwave kills over 1,700 people in Spain and Portugal
92.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Europe has claimed over 1,700 lives in Portugal and Spain alone, the World Health Organization's European office said. The agency believes the figure would "increase further over the coming days". "Climate change is not new. Its consequences, however, are mounting season after season, year after year, with disastrous outcomes," WHO Europe office Director Hans Kluge said.

93.title: Chhattisgarh to start process to recruit 10,000 school teachers: CM Baghel
93.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has announced that the state government will soon start the process of recruiting "10,000 new teachers" for its schools. "Since 1998, the state government has recruited 14,000 teachers so far," CM Baghel said. He also added that 163 mobile veterinary units would be rolled out soon for the treatment of animals in the state.

94.title: I'm vacating Shikaripura seat, son Vijayendra will contest: Yediyurappa
94.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and BJP leader BS Yediyurappa said on Friday that he will be vacating his Shikaripura constituency seat and won't contest the next Assembly election. He added that his son Vijayendra will contest from the constituency. He also urged people to make sure that Vijayendra wins with a margin "bigger" than his own.

95.title: BJP MP writes to Scindia seeking more int'l flights from Pune
95.article_body: BJP MP from Pune Girish Bapat has written a letter to Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, saying that people have approached him to ask civil aviation authority to start international flights from the city to Singapore, Bangkok, East Asia, Europe and America. "I'll be thankful...if you'll kindly instruct...civil aviation authority to start more international flights from Pune," he said.

96.title: 2 persons test positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron in Pune
96.article_body: Two persons in Pune have tested positive for the BA.5 sub-variant of the Omicron COVID-19 variant, the Maharashtra Public Health Department informed. The samples of both patients were sent to National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune. The patients tested positive for COVID-19 during routine screening at Pune Airport, between July 3 and 9, while they were returning from Dubai.

97.title: 2 killed, 1 injured as building collapses due to heavy rains in T'gana
97.article_body: Two people died and one was injured after a building collapsed due to heavy rains in Telangana's Warangal district on Saturday. The incident occurred when the debris from the building fell on the adjacent hut where the victims were staying. The deceased were identified as Tippa Rao and Feroze, whereas a woman named Saleema suffered serious injuries in the incident.

98.title: CCI can't probe Facebook just because it owns WhatsApp: Meta tells HC
98.article_body: Meta on Friday opposed the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation into Facebook in relation to WhatsApp's privacy policy in the Delhi High Court. "The fact that one owns the other...WhatsApp would share something with me is no ground to commence investigation," Meta's lawyer said. "The ownership is common but roads are different, policies are different," the lawyer further said.

99.title: Will give more than 10% of my salary: Guj policeman adopts 100 children
99.article_body: A Sub-inspector in Gujarat Police, Hareshbhai L Jabaliya, has adopted 100 children from government school in a village in Dhari. "I adopted 100 students of 1st to 8th standard of government school, and now I am taking charge of their education," Jabaliya said. He added that right now, he will give more than 10% of his salary towards the effort.

100.title: Couldn't have imagined Nadal, Djokovic, Federer, Murray in 1 team: Borg
100.article_body: With Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray set to represent Team Europe in Laver Cup 2022, Team Europe captain and six-time French Open champion Bjorn Borg said he couldn't have imagined them together. "I like our chances," added Borg. Djokovic termed Nadal, Federer and Murray as three of his "biggest all-time" rivals, adding it'll be "truly unique".

101.title: Fake doctor working in private hospital arrested in Hyderabad
101.article_body: Police arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly impersonating a doctor at a private hospital in Hyderabad. The accused, identified as Kudiletti Vijay Kumar, reportedly acquired fake MBBS certificates affiliated to a Russian university for about ₹6.5 lakh and worked at a hospital in Uppal for six months during the COVID-19 pandemic. He later joined a hospital in Meerpet.

102.title: 3 minor sisters, aged 6-9 years, drown in pond in Madhya Pradesh
102.article_body: Three minor sisters drowned in a pond located in Khatami village in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district. The deceased, Asha (6), Kundi (8) and Gundi (9), were daughters of Inam Singh and had drowned while playing in the pond, police said. The deceased's parents got to know about the incident when they were working at an agricultural farm, police added.

103.title: Kallakurichi student's body handed over to parents, last rites held
103.article_body: The body of the 12th class student who allegedly died by suicide after alleging harassment at a Kallakurichi school in Tamil Nadu was handed over to her parents on Saturday. The family of the deceased girl mourned her loss as her body reached her native village in the city. Reports said that the last rites were conducted amid tight security.

104.title: Delhi to start 'Spoken English' course for those who lack communication skills
104.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that the AAP government is starting a 'Spoken English' course for youngsters belonging to poor and middle-class families who lack communication skills. "The Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University would be running this course," he added. "In the next year...we will train one lakh students in spoken English at 50 centres," Kejriwal stated.

105.title: 65-yr-old Mindtree Co-founder Subroto Bagchi to complete his DU degree 40 yrs later
105.article_body: With Delhi University permitting former students to complete their degree exams as part of its centenary programme, 65-year-old Subroto Bagchi, Co-founder of Mindtree, tweeted he is a "student again" and will complete his only "unfinished task". Bagchi said that he was enrolled in the Law Faculty in 1978 but couldn’t complete his degree as he had to leave Delhi.

106.title: Dedicate this to my kids, family: Suriya on National Award
106.article_body: Suriya, who won the National Award for Best Actor for 'Soorarai Pottru', has penned a note thanking his fans for their love and good wishes. "I dedicate this award to my kids Diya, Dev and...my loving family," he wrote. "The overwhelming reception for our film, which was released...on OTT during...pandemic, has made our eyes well up in joy," Suriya added.

107.title: CISF personnel shoots self dead at Kolkata airport's staff toilet
107.article_body: A CISF personnel allegedly shot himself dead at a staff toilet in the basement at Kolkata's Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport, police said. The deceased's body, which has been sent for post-mortem examination, was found on Friday after airport security personnel rushed to the toilet on hearing a gunshot, police added. A case of unnatural death has been registered.

108.title: Russo Brothers in talks with Farhan, Ritesh Sidhwani for a collaboration
108.article_body: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Anthony Russo and Joe Russo are in early talks with Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani, the owners of Excel Entertainment, for a collaboration. "At this moment, I can only say that it's an exchange of ideas at this stage," Anthony said. Anthony added that Farhan and Ritesh have a "brilliant knack for telling disruptive stories".

109.title: Want guys to take risks; continue playing in the fashion we want: Buttler
109.article_body: After winning the second ODI against South Africa on Friday, England ODI skipper Jos Buttler has said that he wants his players "to back themselves and take risks". "It's paramount [that] guys continue to try and play in the fashion we want to as a team," Buttler said. "We're trying to put pressure back on them (opposition)," he added.

110.title: Thai PM survives 4th no-confidence vote in Parliament
110.article_body: Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha and 10 cabinet ministers on Saturday survived no-confidence votes in Parliament. The 68-year-old former army chief received 256 votes in favour and 206 against with nine abstentions, securing his place as PM until his term ends in March next year. It was the fourth time Prayut's performance had been put to a vote since 2019.

111.title: Media running kangaroo courts, ill-informed debates detrimental to democracy: CJI
111.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has said, "Of late, we see media running kangaroo courts, at times on issues even experienced judges find difficult to decide." "Ill-informed and agenda driven debates on issues involving justice delivery are proving to be detrimental to health of democracy," he added. "Print media still has a certain degree of accountability," he further said.

112.title: NDA stands for 'No Data Available': Rahul criticises govt over lack of data
112.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led NDA government for allegedly not having data on various points. "No Data Available [NDA] government wants you to believe [that]...no one died of oxygen shortage...no farmer died protesting...no migrant died walking...no one was mob lynched...no journalist has been arrested," Rahul tweeted. He also shared a GIF, which said, "Sab Gayab Si."

113.title: Yasin Malik begins hunger strike in Tihar jail over fair trial
113.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik has begun a hunger strike in Tihar jail, demanding a fair trial in his case, prison officials said on Saturday. Malik, the chief of banned Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front, is serving a life sentence in a terror funding case. He'd moved an application to the Central government requesting a physical hearing in two cases.

114.title: Kapiva's Dr Anand recommends Hair Care Juice to reduce hair loss
114.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims that 93% of Hair Care Juice users observed a reduction in hair fall while 72% observed an increased hair growth. Dr Anand, Ayurvedacharya at Kapiva shared that inner nutrition with ingredients like Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha, and Amla stimulates the scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, combats breakage and hair loss due to stress.

115.title: Auto driver gets 20-year jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Kerala
115.article_body: A 42-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was sentenced to 20 years in prison by a court in Kerala's Kottayam for sexually assaulting a minor girl over a period of one year. The court also imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh on the man. The convict, Sebi, used to abuse the child while dropping her home from school.

116.title: Talk that Kohli should be replaced is too premature: Ajit Agarkar
116.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said there is a lot of talk that Virat Kohli should be replaced, terming it as "too premature". "There are other players who are performing well but that doesn't mean you have to start questioning Kohli," added Agarkar. India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev had suggested that Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side.

117.title: Adani adds more wealth than anyone else, gets richer by $36 billion this year
117.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani has added nearly $36 billion to his wealth this year, more than anyone else among the world's 500 richest people, as per Bloomberg. Adani recently overtook Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a net worth of $112 billion. Notably, Adani recently pledged $7.7 billion to charity to mark his 60th birthday.

118.title: No physical classes for kids under 12 in Manipur over COVID-19
118.article_body: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in the state, the Manipur government on Friday said physical classes for children below 12 years or up to Class 7 till August 7 will not be allowed. It added that Classes 8 and above will be allowed to reopen from July 25 while observing COVID-appropriate behaviour and adhering to government's guidelines.

119.title: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan passes away
119.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan has passed away. Reacting to the news of his death, actress Kavita Kaushik wrote, "In shock, gutted, pained...Was a fit guy who never drank/smoked or did anything to harm his health." His co-actor Charrul Malik said, "I can't believe it still...I just met him yesterday and he was all fine."

120.title: 3 Kerala policemen suspended after man dies upon release from custody
120.article_body: A sub-inspector, an assistant sub-inspector and a civil police officer were suspended in Kerala's Kozhikode following the death of a 42-year-old man upon his release from police custody. The deceased's relatives alleged that the police had brutally beaten the man. "A report prima facie suggests there were lapses on behalf of the policemen," a police official said.

121.title: England's Jonathan Trott appointed head coach of Afghanistan
121.article_body: Former England batter Jonathan Trott has been appointed as the new head coach of the Afghanistan men's cricket team. Trott will be replacing former English cricketer Graham Thorpe and will join during Afghanistan's tour to Ireland next month, the Afghanistan Cricket Board said. "I'm...excited to have the opportunity to take one of international cricket's most exciting teams," Trott said.

122.title: Waiter stabs cook to death at a 3-star hotel in Mumbai
122.article_body: A waiter allegedly stabbed a cook to death at a 3-star hotel in Andheri East in Mumbai. The accused, Madhav Mandal (27), had an argument with the deceased, Jagdish Jalal (42), over a customer's order at midnight and after losing his temper, Mandal killed Jalal at around 8 am, police said. Notably, Mandal is a resident of Bhayandar, Mumbai.

123.title: 30-yr-old gang-raped by 2 railway employees inside Delhi railway station's staff room
123.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by two railway employees inside the electrical maintenance staff room of a railway station in Delhi on Thursday. An FIR of gang-rape has been registered and four railway employees, including two who guarded the room from outside. All four accused were arrested within two hours of an FIR being registered.

124.title: If Rajiv was here, I'd have given him something: Randhir on National Award
124.article_body: Randhir Kapoor has said he's very happy for his late actor-brother Rajiv Kapoor whose 'Toolsidas Junior' won the National Award for Best Hindi Film. "If he was there, I would have given him something," Randhir added. "I am very happy. It's a very good picture. He has acted very well in the film. I am delighted," he further said.

125.title: BSF opens fire at suspected Pakistani drone in Jammu; search launched
125.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) opened fire at a suspected Pakistani drone along the international border in Jammu on Friday night, a senior official said. The incident occurred when the BSF troops noticed a blinking red light coming from the Pakistani side. The troops then immediately opened fire at the drone and later launched a search operation in the area.

126.title: Poland to buy jets, tanks and howitzers from South Korea
126.article_body: Polish Defence Minister Mariusz Blaszczak has said that the country will buy 180 K2 "Black Panther" tanks, 48 FA-50 fighter planes and an undefined number of K9 howitzers from South Korea. "We're signing contracts next week," he added. Poland, a NATO member bordering Ukraine, is boosting its defence capabilities in a bid to counter a possible threat from Russia.

127.title: Punjab CM’s residence in Chandigarh fined ₹10,000 after complaints of littering
127.article_body: The Chandigarh Municipal Corporation has imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on Punjab Chief Minister residence in Chandigarh's Sector 2 after complaints of littering by staff and visitors since last year. "Chief Minister is supposed to set good example for the state to follow but...here his own official house is not in order," local BJP Councillor Mahesh Inder Singh Sidhu said.

128.title: Musk is doing his best to run us down, it’s attempted sabotage: Twitter
128.article_body: Twitter's attorney argued that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "doing his best to run Twitter down" after he terminated the $44 billion deal. William Savitt said, "It’s attempted sabotage." Musk's attorney Andrew Rossman replied, the Tesla CEO has "no interest in damaging the company" and is Twitter’s second-largest shareholder with a "far larger stake" than its entire board of directors.

129.title: Man killed after truck runs over him in Delhi's Geeta Colony
129.article_body: A 55-year-old man died after a truck ran over him near the SDM office in Geeta Colony, Delhi, on Thursday. The deceased, Pradeep Kumar, worked as a typist at the SDM office and was a resident of Delhi's Gandhi Nagar area. Notably, the unidentified suspected driver is absconding while a truck with Haryana's registration number has been seized, police said.

130.title: Mega block to affect services on Santacruz-Goregaon fast lines on July 24
130.article_body: Services on fast lines between Santacruz and Goregaon will remain affected for five hours on July 24 from 10 am to 3 pm as the Railways will be undertaking a mega block. Maintenance work of tracks, signalling and overhead equipment on fast lines will be carried out. During this period, suburban services will run on slow lines between these stations.

131.title: Over 28,000 Indians waiting to adopt child, trend not declining: Govt
131.article_body: About 28,663 Indians are waiting to adopt a child in the country, the government said on Friday, and noted that the number of adoptions is not declining. While responding to a question in Lok Sabha, Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani informed that 1,030 foreign applicants are registered with Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA) for adoption.

132.title: Submit documents to prove majority in Shiv Sena: ECI to Shinde, Thackeray
132.article_body: The Election Commission of India has asked Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde to submit documentary evidence to prove their majority numbers in Shiv Sena. Thackeray and Shinde have been directed to submit written statements by 1 pm on August 8. "Both the groups claim to be the real Shiv Sena with their leader being the alleged Sena president," ECI stated.

133.title: If someone spent 10-15 days with Raj, they don't have to be assistant: Anees
133.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said late actor Raj Kapoor was institute and if someone spent 10-15 days with him, they don't have to be assistant. "I was assistant with Jainendra Jain...[in] Prem Rog but due to some reasons...he couldn't do it so Raj Kapoor sir stepped in...it was my luck and then I worked with him for three-four years," he added.

134.title: He was Tanhaji in the truest form: Om Raut on Ajay's National Award
134.article_body: Director Om Raut in an interview congratulated Ajay Devgn for winning the Best Actor National Award for 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', saying, "He was Tanhaji in the truest form." He added that the film had the "wholehearted support of Ajay Devgn sir, who not only agreed to play the lead but also took the efforts to produce it".

135.title: Putin congratulates President-elect Droupadi Murmu
135.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has congratulated President-elect Droupadi Murmu. In a statement, Putin said, "We attach much importance to the relations of special privileged strategic partnership with India. I hope your activities as the head of state will promote the further development of the Russian-Indian political dialogue and productive cooperation in different areas."

136.title: Best cover shot India has seen: Masaba on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
136.article_body: Reacting to actor Ranveer Singh posing nude, former Windies captain Viv Richards and actress Neena Gupta's daughter Masaba Gupta termed it on Instagram as the "best cover shot" India has seen. "Brave & unapologetic," added Masaba, while commenting on Ranveer's post. "It's so easy...to be physically naked...I can be naked in front of a thousand people," Ranveer had said.

137.title: UP thief being brought to Mumbai jumps off train to escape police; dies
137.article_body: A 30-year-old man arrested from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly committing theft in Mumbai died after jumping off a train near Manmad to escape police. He perhaps thought the train had slowed down, police said. He was being brought to Mumbai. The deceased had recently broken into an imitation jewellery shop in Kandivali and stole copper plates worth a few lakhs.

138.title: Satellite pics show water level at US' largest reservoir at its lowest since 1937
138.article_body: Satellite pictures shared by NASA show water levels in Lake Mead, the largest reservoir in the US, at the lowest since it was filled in April 1937. At its maximum capacity, Lake Mead can hold 36 trillion litre of water and it last approached full capacity in 1983 and 1999. It is currently filled to just 27% of its capacity.

139.title: No ceasefire without recovering land lost to Russia: Ukraine Prez
139.article_body: A ceasefire with Russia without reclaiming lost territories would only prolong the war, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in an interview with The Wall Street Journal. "We'd prefer to de-occupy in a way that's not military and to save lives...But we're dealing with who we're dealing with. Until they get smashed in the face, they won't understand anything," he added.

140.title: Musk’s team underestimated court's ability: Judge as it sets Oct trial for Twitter case
140.article_body: A Delaware judge while ruling that Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion deal will be held in October, said his team underestimated the "court’s ability to quickly process complex litigation". Chancellor Kathaleen St. Jude McCormick added, "Delay threatens irreparable harm." Musk’s team while opposing Twitter's expedited trial bid, suggested it be held next year.

141.title: BBMP suspends 2 engineers as roads built before PM's visit wear out
141.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Friday suspended two engineers after roads constructed ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit on June 20 started to peel off. The civic body had revealed that ₹23 crore was spent to redevelop and repair about 14 km of roads, which wore out within 15 days of construction.

142.title: No decision yet on implementation of Uniform Civil Code in country: Rijiju
142.article_body: The Centre on Friday said that it has not yet taken any decision on the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. "There are some writ petitions pending in the Hon'ble Supreme Court...regarding UCC. Since the matter is sub-judice, no decision on implementation of UCC...has been taken as of now," Union Minister Kiren Rijiju informed the Lok Sabha.

143.title: Feels like a win, everyone saw what we're capable of: Pooran on 1st ODI
143.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his team's defeat by three runs in the first ODI against India "feels like" a win. "Bittersweet...but...everyone saw what we are capable of and hopefully we can go strength to strength from here," added Pooran. "It's difficult to lose but we will take this one," he stated. The second ODI will be played tomorrow.

144.title: Didn't expect them to come this close: Dhawan on 3-run win vs WI
144.article_body: Discussing India's win by three runs in the first ODI against West Indies, India's stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan said they didn't expect West Indies to come this close. "We had nerves...We have to get better," added Dhawan. "We gave doubles to fine leg. One of them should have been a run-out," he stated. Dhawan was the top run-getter scoring 97(99).

145.title: Maha makes fire evacuation lifts mandatory for high-rises equal to or above 70 metres
145.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Department has mandated that all high-rise buildings equal to or above 70 metres (22 floors) across the state should have Fire Evacuation Lifts (FELs). "Evacuation process happens faster through lifts when compared to staircases," Mumbai Fire Brigade chief fire officer said. Notably, only 13 high-rises out of 368 skyscrapers in Mumbai are equipped with FELs.

146.title: Principal's 20-yr-old son sexually assaults 9-yr-old student in Hyd
146.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Friday for allegedly sexually assaulting a nine-year-old female student in a room on the terrace of a private school in Hyderabad's Moin Bagh. The accused is the son of the school's principal. A case was filed under sections of the Indian Penal Code and the POCSO Act after the girl's parents filed a complaint.

147.title: Bengaluru Metro becomes first in India to conduct 5G network trials
147.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) on Friday said it has become the first Metro in India to test 5G network. The 5G network, deployed at MG Road station, was tested under a pilot project of TRAI (Telecom Regulatory Authority of India). It gave a download speed of 1.4 Gbps and an upload speed of 65 Mbps, BMRCL tweeted.

148.title: $130 billion wiped off social media companies' market value in a day
148.article_body: American social media companies lost more than $130 billion from their combined stock market value on Friday. The wipeout comes after Twitter and Snap's quarterly results raised concerns about the outlook for online advertising. Shares of Snap fell 39% to its lowest level since March 2020, whereas Alphabet stock declined 5.6% in its biggest one-day drop in over 2 years.

149.title: Woman lay dead in UK flat for over 2 years; landlord kept taking rent
149.article_body: A landlord in the UK cut off gas and kept taking rent from a tenant as she lay dead in the flat for over two years. The remains of the woman, Sheila Seleoane, were found in February. She had to be identified by dental records after her skeletal remains were found on the sofa in the living room.

150.title: People haven't lost faith in MVA, they're disgusted by dirty politics: Aaditya
150.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray has said that the people haven't lost faith in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA), rather they're "disgusted with the dirty politics of greed" displayed by the rebel party leaders. He also blamed the "greed of traitors" for the split in the party, adding, "The other blame may be is on us, for trusting too much."

151.title: Hotel manager puts liquor sale ad outside Pune university, held
151.article_body: Pune police have arrested a hotel manager based on a Facebook post by an advocate alleging that the hotel had put up an advertisement for the sale of liquor outside a private university. The advertisement, stating- "unlimited liquor for two hours for ₹799", was put up despite a liquor sale ban within 100 metres of an educational institution's entrance.

152.title: Feels like I've done something good: 'Soorarai...' maker on National Award win
152.article_body: Director Sudha Kongara, whose 'Soorarai Pottru' won multiple awards at the 68th National Film Awards, said, "I feel fantastic that a mainstream film is getting...National Award." "It feels damn good and feels like I've done something good," she added. 'Soorarai Pottru' was awarded in the Best Feature Film, Best Screenplay and Best Music Direction (Background Music) categories.

153.title: Attackers beat Raj Sikh Granthi, talk of cutting neck; put chilli in eyes
153.article_body: Unidentified attackers beat up a Sikh Granthi in Rajasthan's Alwar, reports said. A report that was filed with police said that the attackers were talking of cutting off the Granthi's neck. The victim reportedly said that the attackers cut off his hair. Reports added that they also put chilli powder in the victim's eyes.

154.title: People tell me 'you started a makeup company because you look bad': Vineeta Singh
154.article_body: SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh, speaking about facing online trolls, said, "I'm the CEO of a company...even now, people are...commenting things like...'You started a makeup company because you look so bad'." The Shark Tank India judge added, "I've achieved so much in life, but when I post something [on Instagram], 95% of the comments are about the way [I] look."

155.title: Russia claims it destroyed 4 US-made HIMARS launchers in Ukraine
155.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Friday said that its forces have destroyed four US-made High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) in Ukraine. The "four launchers and one reloading vehicle for the HIMARS were destroyed" between July 5-20, the ministry added. Ukraine has rejected Moscow's claims, calling them "fakes" designed to undermine the West's support for the country.

156.title: So happy and proud: Kajol as 'Tanhaji...' wins 3 National Awards
156.article_body: After her film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won three National Awards, Kajol wrote on Instagram, "So happy and proud." The Om Raut directorial won the National Awards for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment and Best Costume Design. Ajay Devgn was awarded the Best Actor for his performance in the film. Kajol played the role of Savitribai Malusare.

157.title: West Bengal minister Partha arrested by ED after ₹20 crore cash found at aide's home
157.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The ED on Friday recovered ₹20 crore in cash from the house of an aide of Chatterjee. "The said amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam," the probe agency had said.

158.title: I like getting kicked in matches: Manchester City's Jack Grealish
158.article_body: Manchester City's Jack Grealish, who's the most expensive Premier League footballer, said he "likes" getting kicked by opponents during matches. "It gets me going...I get it at a lot of places," added Grealish. Grealish joined City from Aston Villa for £100 million. Talking about Grealish, ex-Aston Villa manager Tim Sherwood earlier said he hadn't seen anyone get kicked so much.

159.title: 79-yr-old Ashok Soota launches his 3rd startup, aims to take it to IPO in 5 yrs
159.article_body: Entrepreneur Ashok Soota, 79, has launched his latest venture Happiest Health, which he aims to take to IPO in five years. Soota worked at Wipro from 1985 to 1999, after which he quit and co-founded rival company Mindtree Limited, bringing it to an IPO in 2007. He then founded Happiest Minds Technologies in 2011, which had its IPO in 2020.

160.title: Trump's former advisor found guilty of contempt of Congress
160.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-advisor Steve Bannon was convicted on Friday of contempt of Congress for defying a congressional subpoena from the US House committee probing the Capitol riot. Bannon was found guilty of refusing to appear for a deposition and refusing to provide documents in response to the committee's subpoena. He faces up to two years in jail.

161.title: 2 brothers beaten up in Delhi’s Shahdara for objecting to drinking in public
161.article_body: A 25-year-old man and his brother were allegedly beaten up in Delhi's Shahdara for objecting to a man drinking and smoking outside a public toilet. Police have arrested two persons named Shahrukh and Aamir. The incident took place on Wednesday night when Danish, who sells lemons in the market, asked Shahrukh not to drink in open, leading to an argument.

162.title: Bihar man asks for ₹600 he lent, dies after head smashed on road
162.article_body: A man from Bihar, Bharat Shah, died after his head was allegedly smashed on the road after he asked to be returned ₹600 that he lent to a man. Bharat had lent ₹600 to a man, Mohammad Faizal, to book a train ticket in May this year. Fight broke out between them when Shah went to ask for his money.

163.title: Govt has no data on Anganwadi workers who died due to COVID-19: Irani
163.article_body: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani informed the Lok Sabha on Friday that the government has no data on the number of Anganwadi workers who died due to COVID-19. "As Anganwadi services is a scheme implemented by states/UTs, the data on the number of Anganwadi workers who died due to coronavirus is not available with this ministry," Irani added.

164.title: AAP to contest all wards in B'luru civic polls, invites candidates
164.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party Karnataka chief Prithvi Reddy on Friday said that the party will contest polls in all wards of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). "As a part of the 'One Chance to Kejriwal' campaign, a Candidate Search Committee has been formed," Reddy said. We invite people from different walks of life to fight elections, he added.

165.title: Active COVID-19 cases in India cross 1,50,000 mark
165.article_body: Active COVID-19 cases in India have crossed the 1,50,000 mark as the country reported 21,411 cases and 67 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 21,880 COVID-19 cases. The number of COVID-19 deaths in the country has risen to 5,25,997.

166.title: Bengaluru reports 1,244 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
166.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,244 new COVID-19 cases and 996 recoveries, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Friday. The number of active cases was 7,355, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.63%. No deaths were reported in this period. Nearly two crore vaccines have been administered so far in the city.

167.title: Rachakonda Police bust human trafficking racket, 2 women rescued
167.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Friday said that they have busted an inter-state human trafficking racket and arrested six persons. Police also rescued two Bangladeshi sisters, including a 15-year-old girl, during the operation. According to police, the accused had links to Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Rajasthan and smuggled young girls from Bangladesh and other parts of the country into the city.

168.title: Man sucked to his death as sinkhole opens under swimming pool during party in Israel
168.article_body: A man was sucked to his death after a sinkhole opened under a swimming pool he was in at a house party in Israel. The incident happened at a villa which was hosting a company event in the central town of Karmi Yosef. The victim has been identified as a 32-year-old employee of the company.

169.title: That run-out was too casual: Agarkar on Gill's dismissal in 1st ODI
169.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Shubman Gill's dismissal after getting run-out in the first ODI against West Indies was "too casual". "That (run-out) is the one thing you don't want to do. Shikhar Dhawan is probably going to teach him today, that once you get a start, don't...give it away," added Agarkar. Gill scored 64 runs in 53 balls.

170.title: May shift business from Zomato, Swiggy if commissions rise: Domino's
170.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, which runs the Domino's and Dunkin' Donuts chain in India, has said that it will consider taking some of its business away from Zomato and Swiggy, if their commissions rise further. The company was responding to the Competition Commission of India, which is investigating the alleged anti-competitive practices of Zomato and Swiggy.

171.title: Body of 50-year-old man found stuffed in fridge in Delhi, probe on
171.article_body: An investigation was launched after the body of a 50-year-old man was found stuffed in a refrigerator in his house in Northeast Delhi's Seelampur. Primary inquiry said that the man lived alone in the house and his wife and children lived separately at a distance. Police said that a caller informed them that her relative was not attending calls.

172.title: Ghaziabad man stabs wife to death following an argument
172.article_body: A 40-year-old man stabbed his wife to death following an argument in Sector 15, Vasundhara in Ghaziabad. Later, the accused, Vikas Meena, jumped off the building's top floor and sustained a fracture, police said. Vikas' father, Jagdish, claimed that his son suspected that the deceased, Kamini (35), was having an extramarital affair. Notably, Vikas is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

173.title: SC stays HC order refusing to dismiss corruption case against Yediyurappa
173.article_body: Supreme Court granted an interim stay on Karnataka HC order refusing to dismiss corruption charges against former CM BS Yediyurappa in connection with an illegal land denotification case of 2006-07. Yediyurappa's counsel said the probe against him was an abuse of the judicial process. Yediyurappa had "misused his official powers in facilitating large-scale misuse of land", as per the complainant.

174.title: Delhi Police beat us, touched inappropriately in Dwarka: Transpersons
