174.article_body: A group of transpersons alleged that they were beaten up mercilessly with sticks and one of them was touched inappropriately by Delhi Police at Dwarka's Dabri Police Station. They alleged police took a person from the shelter home who they said was reported missing by parents and sent the person away. When they objected, they were reportedly assaulted.

175.title: Suspecting stay with another man, Maha man stabs wife 10-12 times; kills her
175.article_body: Suspecting that his wife was staying with another man, a man from Navi Mumbai's Vashi stabbed his wife to death on Friday. Reports said that he stabbed his wife 10-12 times. The accused allegedly also attacked his friend and a pedestrian, both of whom tried to stop him. The accused injured himself too and is admitted to hospital currently.

176.title: Ukraine has around $10 bn worth of grain available for sale: Zelenskyy
176.article_body: After Ukraine and Russia sealed a deal with Turkey and UN to restart the export of Ukrainian grains, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine has around $10 billion worth of grain available for sale. "This is another demonstration that Ukraine can withstand...war," he added. The Russian military's blockade of Ukrainian ports had halted grain exports, causing a global food crisis.

177.title: Fruits worth lakhs damaged, washed away due to heavy rains in Hyd
177.article_body: Fruits worth lakhs of rupees were damaged in Hyderabad's Batasingaram fruit market on Friday as the city witnessed heavy rains. A lot of sweet limes, pomegranates, apples and other fruits were washed away as rainwater collected in the market, according to traders. Following this, authorities put up a shed at the market as it was shifted to a safer location.

178.title: 44-yr-old lawyer shoots himself to death in Hyderabad
178.article_body: A 44-year-old lawyer allegedly shot himself dead at his residence in Hyderabad's Bagh Lingampally area on Friday, police said. The deceased, identified as Shiva Reddy, had retired as sergeant from the Air Force and was currently practicing as an advocate. Shiva was a divorcee and lived alone, police said. He is suspected to have shot himself with his licensed pistol.

179.title: Pantry car staffer, 2 others held in Pune over girl's rape in train
179.article_body: Railway police have arrested three people, including a pantry car staffer, from Pune over the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in the pantry car of the Jhelum Express train. The incident occurred on July 19 when the girl inadvertently boarded the train, the police said. The girl has identified the main accused in the case, the police added.

180.title: Saw myself in burning grave in dreams: Sana Khan on quitting showbiz
180.article_body: Discussing her decision to quit her showbiz lifestyle forever in 2020, former actress Sana Khan said, "[During] Ramadan 2019, I used to...see myself in [a] burning and blazing grave [in my dreams]." "In my past life, of course, I had everything, I had fame, name, money...[The] one thing that was missing was 'peace in my heart'...I was...depressed," she added.

181.title: US reports its first cases of monkeypox in children
181.article_body: The US has reported its first cases of monkeypox in children, with health authorities saying that one patient is a California toddler and the other is a non-US resident infant who was "transiting through" the Washington DC area. The two cases are unrelated and are likely the result of household transmission, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

182.title: 6 dead after Kanwariyas from Madhya Pradesh mowed down by truck in UP
182.article_body: At least six people died after Kanwariyas were mowed down by a speeding truck in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district on Saturday. The devotees from Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior were returning from Haridwar when the truck ran over them at around 2:15 am, Rajeev Krishna, Additional Director General of Police, said. Police added probe in the matter is on.

183.title: Annu records best finish by an Indian in women's javelin throw at World C'ships
183.article_body: National record holder Annu Rani recorded the best finish by an Indian in women's javelin throw final in World Athletics Championships history. The 29-year-old finished seventh in the final at World Athletics Championships 2022 with a best throw of 61.12 metres. She bettered her own position, having finished eighth in the final of the World Athletics Championships 2019.

184.title: Delhi Police head constable shoots self with service pistol inside car
184.article_body: A Delhi Police Crime Branch head constable, identified as Narendra, was found dead inside his car in the parking area of the police colony in Laxmi Nagar on Friday, DCP (East) Priyanka Kashyap said. He allegedly shot himself dead using his service pistol. Narendra was troubled by family issues, as per the initial investigation. He joined Delhi Police in 2010.

185.title: Sufficient stock in dams after heavy rains, no water cuts for now: PMC
185.article_body: There will be no more water cuts in Pune city considering the sufficient water stock in all four dams upstream of Mutha river after heavy rains, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. "Regular water supply will continue after July 26...there's no water cut planned," it added. The dams have a total of 20 TMC (thousand million cubic feet) of water stock.

186.title: Vince McMahon retires as WWE chief amid sexual misconduct allegations
186.article_body: Vince McMahon has retired as WWE chief amid sexual misconduct allegations against him. "As I approach 77 years old...I feel it's time for me to retire as Chairman and CEO of WWE," he said. WWE's board is investigating the allegations that McMahon paid more than $12 million to four different women to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity.

187.title: Google fires engineer who claimed its AI chatbot 'behaved like a human'
187.article_body: Google has fired the software engineer who claimed that the company's AI chatbot LaMDA had become "sentient" and was behaving like a human being. While Blake Lemoine was placed on leave last month, Google said it had "extensively" reviewed Lemoine’s claims and found them "wholly unfounded". In June, Lemoine posted a detailed blog explaining his reasons for calling LaMDA "sentient".

188.title: PM Modi hosts farewell dinner for outgoing President Kovind, shares pics
188.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday hosted a farewell dinner for outgoing President Ram Nath Kovind. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "Hosted a dinner in honour of President Kovind Ji. Smt Droupadi Murmu Ji, Venkaiah Ji, other esteemed dignitaries including Ministers were present." He added, "We were also glad to welcome several grassroots level achievers, Padma awardees, tribal community leaders and others."

189.title: India record their 6th consecutive victory against West Indies in ODI cricket
189.article_body: India defeated West Indies by three runs in the first ODI in Trinidad's Port of Spain to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. India have now won six consecutive ODI matches against West Indies. Captain Shikhar Dhawan top-scored with 97(99) as India put up a total of 308/7. West Indies were restricted to 305/6 in their 50 overs.

190.title: Delhi CM skips weekly meeting called by LG amid tensions: Report
190.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal skipped the weekly meeting called by Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Friday, ANI reported. This comes after the LG refused to give permission to Kejriwal to travel to Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. Notably, Saxena has also recommended a CBI probe into the alleged violations of the Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22.

191.title: Ukraine's military has potential to make gains on battlefield: Prez
191.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said his military forces can make gains on the battlefield against Russia and inflict "significant new losses on the occupiers". Zelenskyy's remarks came as UK intelligence said the Russian military was set to enter a period of operational pause in coming weeks. Russia is reportedly facing a shortage of critical resources in its war.

192.title: 19-year-old man arrested over Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's murder
192.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested a 19-year-old man named Mohammed Javed in connection with the murder of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal. He's the eight person to be arrested in the case. Kanhaiya was beheaded in his shop in June for sharing a social media post supporting the now-suspended BJP politician Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

193.title: NIA declares ₹10 lakh cash reward on fugitive terrorist Hardeep Nijjar
193.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) has announced a cash reward of ₹10 lakh on Canada-based fugitive terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar. The chief of Khalistan Tiger Force is linked to a conspiracy to kill a Hindu priest in Punjab last year. The conspiracy was allegedly hatched by Nijjar and another man, Arshdeep Singh, to disrupt the communal harmony in Punjab, NIA said.

194.title: UK drivers face hours-long delay at Dover Port
194.article_body: UK drivers faced hours-long delays at Dover Port on Friday, resulting in traffic snarls that stretched up to miles. Dover officials said shortage of French border officials led to waiting period going up to six hours. After Britain's exit from the European Union in 2020, UK travellers are subject to stricter border checks when traveling to the continent.

195.title: Ukraine & Russia sign UN-backed deal to resume Ukrainian grain exports
195.article_body: Russia and Ukraine signed separate but identical agreements with Turkey and the UN on Friday to resume the export of Ukrainian grains amid the war. UN Secretary-General António Guterres called it "a beacon of hope" for millions of people who have faced huge increases in food costs. The Russian military's blockade of Ukrainian ports had halted the grain exports.

196.title: Ravindra Jadeja to not feature in 2nd ODI against West Indies as well
196.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the second ODI against West Indies as well. Jadeja sustained an injury to his right knee and wasn't named in India's playing XI for the first ODI. "The BCCI Medical team is monitoring his progress and...decision on his participation in the third ODI will be taken accordingly," an official statement read.

197.title: 4 inter-state robbers among 7 arrested after encounter in Mathura
197.article_body: Four inter-state robbers were among the seven persons arrested following an encounter on Thursday with police in UP's Mathura district, a senior police official said. Five motorcycles and two 315-bore pistols with four live rounds were among the items recovered from the group's possession, the official added. According to police, two of the inter-state robbers were injured in the encounter.

198.title: ICJ dismisses Myanmar objections to case on Rohingya atrocities
198.article_body: The International Court of Justice on Friday rejected objections by Myanmar to a case holding the country responsible for genocide against the Rohingya ethnic minority. Gambia had filed the case in 2019, saying both countries are party to the 1948 Genocide Convention and must ensure it is enforced. Friday's hearing sets the stage for evidence being produced in court.

199.title: Biden's COVID-19 symptoms improved after Pfizer drug use: Doctor
199.article_body: US President Joe Biden's COVID-19 symptoms improved overnight after taking Pfizer Inc.'s Paxlovid drug for a full day, White House physician Kevin O’Connor said. He further said, “The president is fully vaccinated and twice-boosted, so I anticipate that he will respond favourably." O’Connor added, “There has been nothing... thus far which gives me cause to alter that initial expectation."

200.title: 2 babies killed as tree falls on house during storm in US' Alabama
200.article_body: Two infants were killed when a tree fell on a house during a storm in Alabama's Birmingham in the US. Three-month-old Jalaia Ford and 11-month-old Journee Jones were rushed to a hospital after the incident occurred on Thursday afternoon, authorities told the media. At least three other people were injured in the incident, Birmingham fire department said.

201.title: Russian central bank cuts key interest rate
201.article_body: Russia's central bank on Friday cut its key interest rate by 1.5 percentage points, to 8%, saying inflation was easing due to fall in consumer demand. The slash in rate comes as inflation expectations reached levels of spring 2021 and decline in business activity was slow. However, the central bank noted that the war with Ukraine had constrained economic activity.

202.title: Thai minister denies spyware use by govt after apparent admission
202.article_body: Thailand's Digital Economy Minister on Friday denied the use of spyware for surveillance by his government. Earlier on Tuesday, he had apparently admitted the use of spyware for national security and drug-related cases by the Thai government. "I said I knew of the system... but I did not say that it existed in the Thai government," he said in parliament.

203.title: Belarus Oppn Leader rejects reports of mobilisation of forces
203.article_body: Belarus' Opposition Leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya has rejected media reports that there was a secret mobilisation of forces in Belarus to join Russia in its war against Ukraine. Reacting to the reports, Tsikhanouskaya said it was a ploy for Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko to stay "in focus". She said Belarusian soldiers would not join the war.

204.title: Gabbar is back: Amit Mishra on Dhawan's 97 in 1st ODI vs West Indies
204.article_body: Praising Shikhar Dhawan following the India captain's 99-ball 97 against West Indies in first ODI, Amit Mishra took to Twitter and wrote, "Gabbar is back!! Missed out on a century but led India to driver's seat in this match." Dhawan shared a 119-run opening wicket partnership with Shubman Gill(64). Dhawan was dismissed by Gudakesh Motie in the 34th over.

205.title: Miscreants hurl 3 crude bombs at school gate in UP's Prayagraj
205.article_body: Unidentified miscreants hurled three crude bombs at the gate of Boys High School in Civil Lines area of UP's Prayagraj on Friday. The incident occurred shortly before the closing time of primary classes, the school principal said. No injury has been reported due to the incident. The incident was caught on CCTV camera.

206.title: Japan approves initial plans to release water from wrecked nuclear plant
206.article_body: Japan's nuclear regulatory body on Friday approved initial plans to release treated radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant which was destroyed in the 2011 tsunami. The approval gives Tokyo Electric Power Company the greenlight to build necessary infrastructure to discharge the water after treating it. According to plans, the water will be released into the sea next year.

207.title: 'Elvis' actress Shonka Dukureh found dead in her US apartment aged 44
207.article_body: Actress Shonka Dukureh, who portrayed 'Big Mama Thornton' in this year's movie 'Elvis', has died aged 44. According to the Nashville Metropolitan Police Department, she was found dead in the bedroom of her apartment that she shared with her two young children. Authorities don't suspect any foul play, however, they're awaiting autopsy results for an official cause of death.

208.title: BCCI introduce A+ category for umpires, include 10 umpires
208.article_body: The BCCI have introduced a new A+ category for umpires and have included 10 umpires in it. ICC Elite Panel member Nitin Menon is among the 10 officials grouped in the new category. Others include Anil Chaudhary, Madanagopal Jayaraman, Virender Kumar Sharma, K N Ananthapadmanabhan, Rohan Pandit, Nikhil Patwardhan, Sadashiv Iyer, Ulhas Gandhe and Navdeep Singh.

209.title: India supplied 23.9 cr COVID vaccines to 101 countries, UN entities
209.article_body: Minister of State, Health, Bharati Pravin Pawar on Friday said India has supplied 23.9 crore coronavirus vaccine doses to 101 countries and entities of the United Nations as of July 15, 2022. Pawar said 200.34 crore coronavirus vaccine doses have been administered in the country as of July 19, 2022. Currently, five coronavirus vaccines are available in the country.

210.title: India to host Australia, SA for 3 T20Is each before T20 WC: Ganguly
210.article_body: India will host South Africa and Australia for three T20Is each before going for the T20 World Cup 2022 in October, said BCCI President Sourav Ganguly. The dates and venues are yet to be confirmed. India recently hosted South Africa for a five-match T20I series in June, which ended in a 2-2 draw. World Cup will be held in Australia.

211.title: Truck driver electrocuted in Greater Noida, vehicle goes up in flames
211.article_body: A truck driver died on Thursday after his vehicle came in contact with a live wire in UP's Greater Noida, police said. According to police, the wire caused the driver to get electrocuted and his truck to catch fire while he was still inside. The driver was rushed to a nearby hospital where he was declared dead, police added.

212.title: Police arrests man who helped Haryana DSP murder accused flee to Raj
212.article_body: The Nuh Police on Friday arrested a man for harbouring the key accused in the murder case of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was mowed down by a truck while probing illegal stone mining in Haryana. The arrested man, Jabid, had helped key accused Sabbir flee to Rajasthan on his motorcycle. Police said Jabid is a native of Alwar, Rajasthan.

213.title: BSF seizes 41.4 kg gold worth ₹21.2 cr along India-Bangladesh border
213.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) on Thursday seized 41.49 kg gold worth ₹21.22 crore along the India-Bangladesh border, BSF said on Friday. They seized five bags containing 321 gold biscuits, four gold bars, one gold coin and one wooden country-made boat. This is the biggest single seizure of gold by any Indian law enforcement agency along the India-Bangladesh border, BSF claimed.

214.title: 4 dead, 1 injured as roof collapses due to heavy rains in Patiala
214.article_body: Four members of a family were reported dead after the roof of a house collapsed amid heavy rainfall in Punjab's Patiala on Thursday. Another member of the family has been reported injured due to the incident. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted widespread rainfall with heavy isolated downpours and thunderstorms in UP, Punjab and Haryana.

215.title: Attack by suspected Islamist militants at Mali's main military base
215.article_body: The main military base of Mali, outside capital Bamako, where the country's interim President Colonel Assimi Goita resides came under an attack by Islamist militants on Friday, the military said. The attackers were "vigorously repelled" by the armed forces, the military added. A convoy carrying Colonel Goita left for Bamako from the Kati base after the gunfire subsided, Reuters reported.

216.title: Amber Heard files notice of appeal in Johnny Depp defamation case verdict
216.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has filed a notice of appeal against the verdict of the defamation case filed by her ex-husband Johnny Depp. Heard was directed to pay Depp $10 million. "We believe the court made errors that prevented a just and fair verdict," her spokesperson stated. Earlier, her request for a mistrial over an issue involving a juror was denied.

217.title: 7.9 lakh tonnes food transported in 2,359 Kisan rails since 2020: Govt
217.article_body: In response to a query in Rajya Sabha, the Centre has informed that 7.9 lakh tonnes of perishable food items were transported by 2,359 Kisan rails between August 7, 2020 and June 30, 2022. The Centre added that the highest number of Kisan Rails were operated from Maharashtra during 2020-22. The govt also said that 1,841 services ran in 2021-22.

218.title: SC appoints senior advocate Maninder Singh as amicus curiae in BCCI case
218.article_body: The Supreme Court has appointed senior advocate Maninder Singh as amicus curiae for the case relating to BCCI. Maninder, an ex-additional solicitor general of India, replaces PS Narasimha, who has now become a Supreme Court judge. The apex court has fixed the hearing on the plea of BCCI for amending its constitution concerning tenure of office bearers on July 28.

219.title: Govt shares category-wise list of vacancies in Armed Forces
219.article_body: The government told the Lok Sabha that there are 1,35,850 posts that are lying vacant in Armed Forces. In Indian Army, there are 7,308 vacancies for Officers, 471 for MNS Officers and 1,08,685 for JCOs/OR. There are a total of 13,597 vacancies in Navy. In Indian Air Force, there are 572 vacancies for posts of Officers and 5,217 for Airmen.

220.title: Suhana, Khushi not cast over being star kids: 'The Archies' casting director
220.article_body: The casting director of 'The Archies' Nandini Shrikent said that Suhana Khan, Khushi Kapoor and Agastya Nanda were not cast in the film because of being star kids, adding that it was because of acting powers. "Any industry you look at, the next generation takes over...Each [actor] is very specifically, super-perfect for the role they've been cast in," she said.

221.title: Chinese Prez Xi wishes Biden speedy recovery from COVID-19
221.article_body: China's President Xi Jinping wished his US counterpart Joe Biden a speedy recovery from coronavirus in a message on Friday, Chinese state media reported. Biden had mild symptoms and would work in isolation, the White House had said on Thursday. Notably, Biden has been fully vaccinated against coronavirus and has twice received booster jabs.

222.title: Will be fearing playing a team that has Virat Kohli in it: Ricky Ponting
222.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that Virat Kohli still has the ability to have a "meaningful impact". "I think if I was an opposition captain or an opposition player, I will be fearing playing an Indian team that has Virat Kohli in it, more than I would be one that doesn't have him in it," Ponting noted.

223.title: Man arrested in Noida for escaping with employer's ₹3.25 lakh cash
223.article_body: A grocery shop employee was arrested by police in Noida on Thursday for allegedly fleeing with ₹3.25 lakh cash that the shop owner had given him for procuring items from Ghaziabad. According to police, the accused man had been working in the shop, located in Noida's Sector 58, for eight years. The accused was arrested from Khora T-point, police said.

224.title: Clashes between rival factions leave 13 dead in Libya's capital
224.article_body: Thirteen people were killed and 27 others were injured after clashes broke out between rival factions in Libya's capital Tripoli. A spokesperson for the Interior Ministry said that three of the dead were civilians. The clashes, one of the worst in the city over the past two years, come amid growing tensions between rival governments in the country.

225.title: EU drug agency recommends use of smallpox vaccine for monkeypox
225.article_body: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) on Friday recommended the use of smallpox vaccine Imvanex for the prevention of monkeypox. However, the health agency does not have the authority to permit marketing of the vaccine for monkeypox treatment in EU member nations. Only the European Commission can take a legally binding decision in this regard on the basis of the recommendation.

226.title: Govt to provide 5 units free electricity for planting tree: Jharkhand CM
226.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday announced the state government will provide five units free electricity to those planting and protecting a tree in their house. Speaking at Van Mahotsav programme in Ranchi, Soren said the decision was taken considering concretisation of urban areas. "It should be a proper tree, which'll help in conservation of nature in future," he added.

227.title: My film among champions is a pleasure: Madonne on National Award
227.article_body: Filmmaker Madonne Ashwin, who won the National Award for Best Debut Director for Tamil film 'Mandela', said finding his film among all the champions gives him a lot of pleasure. "I'm so happy that a small film...which was only released on an OTT platform has received such a response," he said. Madonne also won the Best Dialogue Writer for 'Mandela'.

228.title: Dominic Thiem and I want to find our top form again: Alexander Zverev
228.article_body: Germany's Alexander Zverev, who is currently rehabilitating his ankle after undergoing surgery, said he gets along very well with Austria's Dominic Thiem. "We both want to find our top form again because I still have an open account from our last Grand Slam match," he added. Thiem was sidelined for nine months after injuring his wrist in June 2021.

229.title: Tribute to father, Rajiv Kapoor: 'Toolsidas Junior' director on National Award
229.article_body: Speaking about the National Award for 'Toolsidas Junior', director Mridul Toolsidass said he can't imagine a greater tribute to his real and reel fathers. He added the film was his passion project to pay an ode to his father who was portrayed by late actor Rajiv Kapoor. "Unfortunately, my father as well as Rajiv sir passed away before...release," Mridul said.

230.title: It's for women in my life: Vasanth on National Award for 'Sivaranjiniyum...'
230.article_body: Speaking about 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' winning three National Awards, director Vasanth said he considers this to be an award for the women in his life and the film. The film won Best Tamil Film, Best Supporting Actress for Lakshmipriyaa Chandramouli and Best Editing. 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' is a three-part anthology based on short stories by Tamil writers.

231.title: India's 'first-of-its-kind' brain health clinic inaugurated in B'luru
231.article_body: A brain health clinic, said to be the first-of-its-kind in India, was inaugurated on Friday at Bengaluru's Jayanagar General Hospital by Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar. The minister said the clinic has been established by the Karnataka Health Department in association with NIMHANS institute. He said such clinics will also be inaugurated in Kolar and Chikkaballapura districts of Karnataka.

232.title: Head Constable arrested in Ludhiana, 1.8 kg poppy husk seized
232.article_body: Ludhiana Police on Friday said they have arrested a Police Head Constable, Anil Kumar, for allegedly being involved in drug peddling and seized 1.8 kg of poppy husk from him. Police said Kumar was deputed as the gunman for BJP Kisan Morcha National Secretary, Sukhminderpal Singh Grewal. Kumar was arrested during a special checking drive, the investigating officer said.

233.title: Taapsee-starrer 'Dobaaraa' to open Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
233.article_body: The upcoming thriller 'Dobaaraa' which features Taapsee Pannu and Pavail Gulati will be opening the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. The Anurag Kashyap directorial premiered at the London Film Festival on June 23. 'Dobaaraa' is a remake of the 2018 Spanish film 'Mirage' which shows a mother who interacts with the ghost of a child to save his life.

234.title: Russia's military taking hundreds of casualties daily in Ukraine: US
234.article_body: Russia's military is taking hundreds of casualties a day in its war in Ukraine, a senior US defence official said on Friday. The death toll includes thousands of lieutenants and captains, the official added. Notably, Russia classifies military deaths as state secrets even in times of peace and has not updated its official casualty figures frequently during the war.

235.title: I'm a very cool captain: Dhawan on his captaincy style before 1st ODI vs WI
235.article_body: Talking about his captaincy style after the toss in first India-West Indies ODI, Shikhar Dhawan said he's a "very cool captain" and makes sure that the team's energy stays up. "And of course I love to take all...right decisions and keep the process going," he added. Dhawan is leading Team India for the three-match ODI series against West Indies.

236.title: Over 2,700 convicted for crimes against women, children in 3 months: UP govt
236.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday said 2,756 people accused of rape and other crimes against women and children were punished in three months. UP Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi stated from March 25 to July 16, 2022, 328 people were given life imprisonment, 594 people were sentenced for over 10 years and 1,834 for less than 10 years.

237.title: I want to watch 'Sholay' in Tamil, 'Nayakan' in Hindi: Madhavan
237.article_body: Speaking at an event, actor R Madhavan said that he wants to watch the 1975 Hindi film 'Sholay' in Tamil and the 1987 Tamil film 'Nayakan' in Hindi. "Sometimes you don't get to enjoy the performances because you are busy reading subtitles," the actor said. 'Sholay' features Amitabh Bachchan, Dharmendra, Amjad Khan and Sanjeev Kumar. 'Nayakan' features Kamal Haasan.

238.title: There's a need to standardise disaster management system: K'taka CM
238.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said that there is a need to standardise the disaster management system to reduce the impact of disasters on human lives. "For the last 10 years, the state has seen floods almost every alternate year," Bommai said. "It's not possible to prevent natural disasters, but we need...effective measures before and after disasters," Bommai said.

239.title: 4 out of 5 UNSC members support India's bid for permanent seat: Govt
239.article_body: Four out of five permanent members of the UN Security Council (UNSC) support India's candidature for a permanent seat in the top world body, the government informed the Lok Sabha. Various initiatives aimed at building international support for India are being undertaken, it said. "The matter is consistently taken up during bilateral and multilateral meetings at all levels," it added.

240.title: Goa restaurant run by Smriti Irani's daughter gets notice over alleged illegal bar licence
240.article_body: A restaurant operated by Union Minister Smriti Irani's daughter, Zoish, got a notice from the Goa Excise Commissioner for allegedly holding an illegal bar license. The show cause notice said, "The licence was renewed last month, despite the licence holder having passed away on 17/05/2021." The matter is set to be heard in court on July 29.

241.title: Truck overturns on auto after collision in Haryana; 7 killed, 4 injured
241.article_body: At least seven people were killed and four others sustained injuries after a speeding truck overturned on an auto-rickshaw after colliding with it in Haryana's Mewat district on Friday, police said. The injured persons have been admitted to a hospital for treatment, according to a police inspector. The highway was reportedly cleared with the help of a crane.

242.title: Ajinkya Rahane and wife Radhika expecting their 2nd child, share pic
242.article_body: Cricketer Ajinkya Rahane and his wife Radhika Rahane took to Instagram to announce that they are expecting their second child together. Sharing a picture, Radhika wrote, "October 2022." Ajinkya and Radhika were blessed with their first child, daughter Aarya, in October 2019. Ajinkya and Radhika got married in 2014.

243.title: I am rubber, Twitter is glue: Musk after Twitter partially blames him for drop in revenue
243.article_body: After Twitter partially blamed Elon Musk for its drop in revenue, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "I am rubber, Twitter is glue." Twitter's revenue fell year-on-year to $1.18 billion from $1.19 billion. The microblogging firm blamed the drop in revenue on "advertising weakness" and uncertainty related to its pending $44-billion acquisition by Elon Musk.

244.title: 32-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh found dead at Isha Yoga Centre in Tamil Nadu
244.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh was found dead in his room at Isha Yoga Centre near Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. As per Coimbatore District (Rural) Police Superintendent, V Badrinarayanan, the man, identified as Gullu Ramana, had come to the centre on July 15 to attend a six-month programme. "The cause of the death...would be known after the post-mortem," Badrinarayanan added.

245.title: Ricky Martin's husband shares pic with him after nephew withdraws sexual harassment claim
245.article_body: A judge on Thursday decided to not extend a temporary restraining order placed against singer Ricky Martin this month by his nephew after the relative dropped the sexual harassment case. Hours after the court ruling, Martin said that he was a "victim of lies". Martin's husband, Jwan Yosef, shared a picture with him on Instagram and wrote, "Truth prevails."

246.title: Maha CM lifts restrictions on festivals imposed due to COVID-19
246.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has lifted restrictions on festivals which were in force since March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Now, there will be no curbs on Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram processions, among other religious events. The earlier restrictions included ban on processions and curbs on the height of Lord Ganesh idols.

247.title: Devotee donates gold crown worth ₹33 lakh to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
247.article_body: An 80-year-old doctor from Hyderabad donated a gold crown worth ₹33 lakh to Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi on Friday, Shri Saibaba Sansthan Trust CEO Bhagyashree Banayat said. The crown which is studded with diamonds weighs 707 gms in total, she added. Dr Manda Ramkrishna said that he had fulfilled his promise to donate a gold crown to the shrine.

248.title: Forest dept looking for agents selling 'protected' land in Mumbai
248.article_body: Forest department officials are on the hunt for agents who are allegedly selling land and building houses at Sanjay Gandhi National Park in Mumbai which is a Protected Area. A man was detained in connection to the racket on Thursday from Kandivali East. Forest personnel are also being looked at for alleged support to the racket, officials said.

249.title: Over the moon, congratulations brother: Akshay on Suriya's National Award
249.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to congratulate actor Suriya for winning the National Award for Best Actor along with Ajay Devgn for his film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Akshay wrote, "Over the moon to see #SooraraiPottru win the top honours at the National Awards. Heartfelt congratulations my brother...Humbled to be working in the Hindi adaptation of such an iconic film."

250.title: Good luck: Ashwin on Gill's return to ODIs after 18 months in Port of Spain
250.article_body: Reacting to India opener Shubman Gill's return to ODI cricket after 18 months, Ravichandran Ashwin tweeted, "Good luck Gill and team." The 22-year-old is playing in the first ODI against West Indies in Port of Spain today. He scored his maiden half-century in the format in 36 balls. Gill last played in an ODI in December 2020.

251.title: ED seizes ₹20 crore-cash after raids on Bengal minister Partha's aide, others
251.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has seized cash worth ₹20 crore after raiding various premises, including the house of Arpita Mukherjee, an associate of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam, ED stated.

252.title: Vijay Deverakonda wears slippers worth ₹199 at 'Liger' trailer launch
252.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will make his Bollywood debut with 'Liger', wore slippers worth ₹199 at the trailer launch of the film. His stylist Harmann Kaur revealed that the actor wanted to "keep a very underdog look" to "be closest to the character". "I was constantly nervous...and walking in wearing chappals worth ₹199 was really brave of Vijay," Harmann said.

253.title: Reliance Industries' profit jumps 46% to ₹17,955 crore, revenue up 54% in Q1
253.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) consolidated net profit jumped 46.3% to ₹17,955 crore in the April-June quarter from ₹12,273 crore a year ago. Meanwhile, RIL's revenue from operations came in at ₹2,23,113 crore from ₹1,44,372 crore, an increase of 54.5% year-on-year. Further, Reliance Jio reported 23.8% rise in standalone net profit at ₹4,335 crore in Q1.

254.title: 15-16 Cong MLAs voted for Murmu in Presidential poll: Assam CM
254.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday claimed that 15-16 Congress MLAs from the state voted for NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential election. Assam Congress President Bhupen Bora also admitted that there was cross-voting in the Presidential poll. The Congress has 27 MLAs in Assam Legislative Assembly, but three of them have been suspended due to anti-party activities.

255.title: MPs walk out of Parliamentary panel meet, say Agnipath discussion denied
255.article_body: BSP MP Danish Ali and Congress MPs KC Venugopal and Uttam Kumar Reddy, who are part of Parliamentary Standing Committee on Defence, walked out of the committee's meeting on Friday. Venugopal said they had walked out in protest after committee Chairman Jual Oram refused to hold a discussion on the "controversial" Agnipath scheme despite their repeated requests.

256.title: I'm elated to win Best Actor: Ajay Devgn on National Award for 'Tanhaji'
256.article_body: Ajay Devgn, who received the Best Actor Award at the National Awards along with Suriya, said that he is elated to win for 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "I thank everyone, most of all my creative team, the audience and my fans," he added. This is Ajay's third National Award for Best Actor after 'Zakhm' and 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh'.

257.title: India equal Sri Lanka's world record for having most captains in a calendar year
257.article_body: India on Friday equalled Sri Lanka's world record for having most captains in a calendar year. After taking the field in the first ODI against West Indies, Shikhar Dhawan became the seventh captain to lead India in international cricket in 2022. Sri Lanka used seven captains in 2017. No team has had more than seven captains in a calendar year.

258.title: Ex-world no. 3 Thiem reaches 1st Tour-level semis in 14 months in Gstaad
258.article_body: Ex-world number three Dominic Thiem reached his first ATP Tour semi-final since May 2021 after defeating Peruvian qualifier Juan Pablo Varillas 6-4, 6-3 at EFG Swiss Open Gstaad on Friday. The Austrian, who is currently ranked 274, missed the second half of the last season due to wrist injury. Thiem will face second seed Matteo Berrettini in the semi-final.

259.title: Bhuvan Bam injured while shooting for 'Taaza Khabar', calls it freak accident
259.article_body: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam recently injured himself while shooting an action sequence for his upcoming web show 'Taaza Khabar'. He reportedly injured his left arm and shoulder but resumed shooting after a break. "It was a freak accident during the action scenes. Thankfully it wasn't serious. We could thankfully resume the shoot almost immediately after a small break," the YouTuber said.

260.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad police to act against men loitering near schools
260.article_body: Commissioner of Police, Pimpri-Chinchwad, Ankush Shinde has ordered all officials in-charge of police stations to take action against men found loitering near schools and colleges. Officials released helpline numbers 112 and 020-27352500 to share information on persons misbehaving with women and girl students. The move comes as in-classroom studies have begun in the state.

261.title: Indian pair of Tanisha-Ishaan loses in quarters at Taipei Open
261.article_body: India's mixed doubles pair of Ishaan Bhatnagar and Tanisha Crasto crashed out of the Taipei Open after losing in the quarter-final on Friday. The sixth seeds lost to unseeded Malaysians Hoo Pang Ron and Toh Ee Wei 19-21, 12-21 in 32 minutes. Tanisha also lost in women's doubles quarter-final. Meanwhile, third seed Parupalli Kashyap lost in men's singles quarter-final.

262.title: Uncertainty on members per ward in Pimpri-Chinchwad civic polls
262.article_body: The final voters' list for the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation polls has been released but uncertainty prevails on whether the elections will be held on a three-member ward system. The previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government had changed the system to a three-member ward system. Civic officials said the proposal to revert to the old four-member system is before the new Cabinet.

263.title: Follow your inner calling: PM to those who cleared CBSE Class 12 exams
263.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday congratulated students who cleared the CBSE Class 12 exams. "They prepared for these exams through a time when humanity faced a monumental challenge and achieved this success," he said. The PM urged them to follow their inner calling and pursue subjects they are passionate about.

264.title: Indian wrestling team is the best: WFI President ahead of CWG 2022
264.article_body: Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) President Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has said the country's team is the best in the upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022. "However, you can't say we will win all (12) the gold medals because someday, luck also plays a part," he added. CWG will begin on July 28 in Birmingham. Wrestling events to start on August 5.

265.title: 2 criminals wanted in cases including murder arrested in Haryana
265.article_body: Two criminals wanted in multiple cases have been arrested in separate incidents in Haryana, police said. Lokesh alias Gogi was arrested in Rohtak. Police said he was wanted in eight cases including that of murder, attempt to murder and kidnapping. The second criminal, Bijender alias Punji, was wanted in nearly a dozen cases including that of murder, police added.

266.title: ₹100-200 crore club puts pressure on experimenting with subjects: Vaani
266.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has stated in an interview that the concept of the ₹100-200 crore club has put a lot of pressure on filmmakers to continue creating art. "People get scared of experimenting with subjects," she added. The actress further said that it gets harder to mount films on people who are not already at the top of their game.

267.title: Putin is healthy: CIA chief on rumours about Russian Prez's health
267.article_body: Speaking at a security forum, CIA chief Bill Burns said, "There are lots of rumours about President [Vladimir] Putin's health and as far as we can tell, he's entirely too healthy." However, Burns clarified that his remark didn't constitute "a formal intelligence judgment". Notably, Russia has accused Ukraine, the UK and the US of spreading fake information about Putin's health.

268.title: Shoppers Stop announces Weekend Special Offer
268.article_body: Inspired by the fantastic response received on their ongoing sale, Shoppers Stop has decided to go bigger by giving irresistible deals and discounts this weekend, the brand revealed. Customers can avail ‘Buy 1 Get 1’ offer on brands across men's, women's and kids' wear categories. The brand also announced 'Buy 2 at 50% off' offer from July 22 to 24.

269.title: ED seizes jewels, bank deposits worth ₹253 crore of Nirav Modi's firms in Hong Kong
269.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached gems, jewellery and bank deposits worth ₹253.62 crore of companies linked to fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi in Hong Kong as part of a money laundering probe. With this, the total attached and seized assets tally in the case stands at ₹2,650.07 crore, the ED said. Nirav is presently lodged in a UK jail.

270.title: Amazing to be noticed in debut 'Samrat...': Manushi on signing 'Tehran'
270.article_body: Speaking about signing her third film 'Tehran', actress Manushi Chhillar said that it is amazing to have been noticed for her work in debut film 'Samrat Prithviraj'. The film, which features John Abraham, is based on true events. "I...love this genre of films that are inspired by true events and I hope to do my best in 'Tehran'," she added.

271.title: It's our fortune a tribal woman will grace Prez's post: Arjun Munda
271.article_body: Union Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Friday said that it is our fortune that a tribal woman will grace the post of the country's President. "Years after independence, India and its tribal community are growing with new opportunities," he said. His comment comes after Droupadi Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India.

272.title: Jewellery store burgled, valuables worth ₹41 lakh stolen in Thane
272.article_body: Police on Friday said that unidentified persons broke into a jewellery store and stole valuables worth ₹41 lakh in Thane. The accused damaged a wall of a tyre shop next to it and entered the store in Vartak Nagar, police added. The accused stole 652 grams of gold and 40 kg of silver worth ₹41 lakh, police said.

273.title: Cong-JD(S) coalition govt an outcome of 'selfish politics': K'taka CM
273.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in the state was the outcome of 'selfish politics'. "We have seen the worst kind of selfish politics in 2018-19 when alliances were formed with everyone, law and order was compromised to retain power," Bommai said. "That is the politics of attaining and retaining power," he added.

274.title: Not the time for ego: Oppn VP candidate on TMC's decision to skip polls
274.article_body: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva on Friday called TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections "disappointing". "This isn't the time for 'whataboutery', ego or anger," she said. "This is the time for courage, leadership and unity. I believe Mamata Banerjee, who is the epitome of courage, will stand with the Opposition," Alva added.

275.title: Upcoming Pune-B'luru corridor to reduce distance between the cities by 95 km
275.article_body: The upcoming Pune-Bengaluru Greenfield corridor is going to reduce the distance between the two cities by 95 km and travel time by around four to five hours, as per reports. The current distance between the cities is 840 km, which will be reduced to 745 km with the new corridor. The project is in the proposal stage.

276.title: Bihar man kills mother, said her witchcraft killed his wife: Report
276.article_body: A man named Badri Manjhi murdered his mother with an axe and seriously injured his father in Bihar's Naubatpur area on Thursday. This came after Badri's wife developed a severe stomach ache and later died in a hospital. According to a report, Badri attacked his parents after claiming that his wife had died due to 'tantra-mantra' (witchcraft) used by them.

277.title: Have been hearing it for 10 years now, it doesn't matter to me: Dhawan on criticism
277.article_body: On being asked about facing criticism almost every time after failing to score big in a couple of matches, Shikhar Dhawan said, "I don't feel strange. I have been hearing it for 10 years now." "They keep saying, I keep playing. It doesn't matter to me. If it did, I wouldn't have been here today," Dhawan added.

278.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against West Indies
278.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first ODI. Captain Shikhar Dhawan and Shubman Gill will open the batting for India, while Shreyas Iyer has been named vice-captain. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Deepak Hooda, Axar Patel and Prasidh Krishna.

279.title: WI looking forward to India series to correct some rights, wrongs: Pooran
279.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his side is looking forward to correcting some rights and wrongs in ODI series against India. West Indies were whitewashed 3-0 against Bangladesh at home. "We're just looking forward to some things going our way because the guys have been putting in a lot of work," he added. First ODI will be played today.

280.title: Salman Khan seeks weapon licence over death threat letter: Report
280.article_body: Actor Salman Khan has submitted an application to Mumbai Police seeking a weapon licence for personal protection, as per reports. This comes after Salman and his father Salim Khan received a death threat letter last month. A video showed Salman leaving the office of Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar on Friday.

281.title: Jail guard injured after car knocks him down at checkpoint in Gurugram
281.article_body: Gurugram Police on Thursday said that a jail guard, Sanjay Kumar, was injured after being knocked down by a private car at an entry checkpoint of Bhondsi jail. The driver of the car also threatened to kill Kumar before fleeing the scene. "We have identified the car and are conducting raids to nab the driver," an official said.

282.title: SC allows govt to continue with security cover for Mukesh Ambani, family
282.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Centre to continue providing security cover for Reliance Industries' Mukesh Ambani and his family in Mumbai. A vacation bench on June 29 had stayed the orders of Tripura HC on a PIL challenging the grant of security cover to the family. The SC said there was no justification for it to be heard.

283.title: Only SC can examine disputes arising from Prez polls: Delhi HC
283.article_body: All disputes arising from the Presidential or Vice Presidential election can only be examined and decided upon by the Supreme Court, said the Delhi High Court. The court was responding to a petition which sought to prevent lawmakers imprisoned in criminal cases from casting their vote. The plea is not maintainable according to the Constitution, the court said.

284.title: Thought Nadal was going to play until young, he's playing until old: Gonzalez
284.article_body: Former world number five Fernando Gonzalez has said he thought 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal was going to play until young and he is playing until old. "It stopped surprising me," he added. The 36-year-old has won 35 out of 38 matches this season so far. He won four titles, including Grand Slams in Australia and France.

285.title: Man with smuggled gold worth ₹1.21 cr arrested at Varanasi airport
285.article_body: Customs officials seized over two-kg gold of foreign origin from a passenger at Varanasi airport on Friday. The man had come to Varanasi from the UAE in an Air India Express flight. "[The smuggled] gold was kept in the form of 20 gold bars, concealed in black tape and wrapped under waist," an official said. The accused has been arrested.

286.title: 'Forrest Gump' can't be translated, 'Laal...' is very desi: Atul Kulkarni
286.article_body: Actor Atul Kulkarni, who will make his film writing debut with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said that the original 1994 film 'Forrest Gump' cannot be translated and only adapted. "Everything is Indianised in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. It's a very desi film made for Indian audiences," he added. Atul and Aamir earlier worked together in 2006 film 'Rang De Basanti'.

287.title: I'm an entirely new person: Naga Chaitanya on divorce with Samantha
287.article_body: Speaking about his divorce with Samantha Ruth Prabhu, Naga Chaitanya said that he is "an entirely new person". He said that he has changed a lot, adding he couldn't open up much earlier but is able to now. "Feeling very much attached to my family...and friends," he added. The two got married in 2017 and announced their separation in 2021.

288.title: Video shows Ajoy asking to be 'detained' after Cong protests, he replies
288.article_body: A video of Congress leader Ajoy Kumar asking to be taken inside the police bus which was carrying detained Congress leaders after Thursday's protests has gone viral. The video showed Kumar saying, "You need to take me yaar...Humko bhi ghusne do." He later tweeted, "The bus was full...Had it been a demonstration of the RSS-BJP, the bus would've remained empty."

289.title: Who won what at the National Film Awards announced today?
289.article_body: 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment at the 68th National Film Awards announced on Friday. Biju Menon won Best Supporting Actor for Malayalam film 'AK Ayyappanum Koshiyum'. Lakshmipriyaa Chandramouli won Best Supporting Actress for 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' (Tamil). Sachidanandan KR won Best Direction award for 'AK Ayyappanum Koshiyum'.

290.title: How much money does Virat Kohli earn from each sponsored post on Instagram?
290.article_body: As per the HopperHQ's Instagram Rich List 2022, former India captain Virat Kohli earns $1,088,000 (₹8.69 crore) per sponsored post on Instagram. Kohli is currently placed 14th on the HopperHQ's Instagram Rich List 2022. He is the only Asian among the top 25 on the list. Cristiano Ronaldo is on top of the list, earning $2,397,000 per sponsored Instagram post.

291.title: Govt shares state-wise list of MBBS seats in the country
291.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that there are 612 medical colleges in the country with MBBS seats. Tamil Nadu has the highest number of seats (10,725), followed by Karnataka (10,145). Maharashtra has 9,895 MBBS seats, while Uttar Pradesh has 9,053 seats. Out of the total 91,927 seats in the country, 48,012 are government seats, while 43,915 are private seats.

292.title: Shardul is not a good all-rounder like teammate Hardik: Styris
292.article_body: On being asked if India all-rounder Shardul Thakur should play all three ODIs against West Indies, Scott Styris said that Shardul isn't as good an all-rounder as teammate Hardik Pandya. He added that Shardul is fighting for a backup spot rather than one of the players to play as a frontline. Hardik has been rested for the India-West Indies series.

293.title: Wished Murmu on behalf of the people of Odisha: Naveen Patnaik
293.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday said he spoke to newly-elected President Droupadi Murmu and wished her all the very best on behalf of the people of Odisha. "Entire family of 4.5 crore people of Odisha are proud of her achievement," Patnaik tweeted. President-elect Droupadi Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.

294.title: Hyderabad couple dies by suicide by consuming poison, bodies found
294.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday found the bodies of two people, who allegedly died by suicide after consuming poison, and the police suspect that the deceased were in a relationship. Their bodies were discovered in an open space by locals. Police said the man was identified as 25-year-old Satish, a resident of Nalgonda, and the woman's age was ascertained at 23.

295.title: Temple desecrated in Bihar's Kishanganj; 1 arrested
295.article_body: A temple was desecrated in Bihar's Kishanganj district by some "anti-social elements" on Friday, an official said. The devotees found the idol at the Kali temple vandalised which led to the Bajrang Dal, among others, staging a demonstration, the SDM said. He added that the situation is now under control and one of the suspects has been arrested.

296.title: Ajay Devgn, Suriya get Best Actor National Award; Aparna Balamurali named Best Actress
296.article_body: The government today announced the 68th National Film Awards. The award for the Best Actor was won jointly by Ajay Devgn for Hindi film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and Suriya for Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Meanwhile, Aparna Balamurali was named the Best Actress for 'Soorarai Pottru'. The Tamil movie also won the award for Best Feature Film.

297.title: Have gone through mental health issues as a youngster: Robin Uthappa
297.article_body: India cricketer Robin Uthappa revealed that he has gone through "mental health issues" during his younger days. Speaking at an event to mark World Brain Day in Bengaluru, Uthappa said, "I will, in my capacity, do everything to...tell [common man] about the importance of mental health." Notably, Uthappa is the brand ambassador of the Karnataka Brain Health Initiative.

298.title: Traffic curbs issued in Hyderabad in view of Bonalu procession
298.article_body: Hyderabad City Police has issued traffic restrictions in view of Ujjaini Mahankali Bonalu procession on July 25 in the city. Diversions will be enforced from 12 pm to 11 pm on Monday. The Hyderabad Traffic Police requested citizens to avoid the roads that lead to Aliyabad, Lal Darwaza Temple and Mohammed Shukoor Mosque and announced alternate routes for the same.

299.title: Japan identifies China, Russia & N Korea as main security concerns
299.article_body: Japan has identified China, Russia and North Korea as its main security concerns in a defence white paper. It has warned Russia's use of force to resolve a dispute established a precedent that threatens the security of Taiwan, which China claims as its territory. Japan called Russia's invasion of Ukraine a "serious violation of international law".

300.title: I'm living proof of the fact that nepotism never matters: Kashmera Shah
300.article_body: Actress Kashmera Shah, while speaking about nepotism, said, "If someone speaks about nepotism in Bollywood, I take it very personally because I'm living proof of the fact that nepotism never matters." "I was good and hence I got work, thereby helping me shine in this industry. Hence, I don't like people talking against it," Kashmera added.

301.title: Kerala's child rights body directs state to make all schools co-ed
301.article_body: The Kerala Child Rights Commission has directed the education department to convert all schools in the state into co-ed. "We issued an order...[after] we received a complaint in this regard. The aim is to protect our constitutional right to equality," said Manoj Kumar, Chairman of the Child Rights Commission. He added that gender equality should begin at the school level.

302.title: BMC shuts down Mumbai's first digital valet parking due to heavy rains
302.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has shut down Mumbai's first digital valet parking in Dadar due to heavy rainfall this month. The Dadar Vyapari Sangh (DVS) has expressed displeasure over the closure, saying it will create traffic congestion in the area. "We have plans to start the facility again from August 15," BMC Assistant Municipal Commissioner said.

303.title: Woman sets 22-yr-old pregnant daughter-in-law ablaze in T'gana; arrested
303.article_body: A woman in Telangana's Kamareddy was arrested for reportedly pouring petrol on her 22-year-old pregnant daughter-in-law and setting her ablaze. According to police, the woman suffered over 50% burns, lost her four-month-old twins she was carrying and is currently battling for life. Her family alleged she was constantly harassed by in-laws after her love marriage with her husband in 2021.

304.title: 23-yr-old tailor held for killing man over financial dispute in Mumbai
304.article_body: A 23-year-old tailor, Bittukumar Sadhu Sah, was arrested by the Mumbai Crime Branch for allegedly killing a man over a financial dispute in the early hours of Monday. The deceased, 35-year-old Vikas Maheskar, was found dead in Byculla area, police said. Police examined CCTV footage and arrested Bittukumar, who said he killed Maheskar during an altercation over money.

305.title: Capitol rioter who said she wanted to kill US House Speaker jailed
305.article_body: A Capitol rioter who said she wanted to kill US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi during the insurrection has been jailed for 60 days. Dawn Bancroft had filmed a selfie video after storming the US Capitol alongside hundreds of rioters on January 6, 2021, saying that they were looking for the Speaker "to shoot her in the frickin' brain".

306.title: 282 killed, over 200 injured in Pakistan amid heavy rains
306.article_body: At least 282 people have been killed and over 200 people have been injured in Pakistan since June 14 amid heavy rains, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) said. Among those killed, 160 were women and children, it added. Over 5,500 homes, several bridges and shops have been partially or fully damaged in rains across the country, NDMA further said.

307.title: Still haven't recovered from that loss: Gaurav Chopraa on parents' death
307.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chopraa has said the first wave of COVID-19 was extremely tragic for him as he lost both his parents within a span of ten days. He said that he still hasn't recovered from that loss, adding that his parents were "emotionally, intellectually and psychologically a huge force" in his life. "They suddenly went away...it was tormenting," said Gaurav.

308.title: Mom was worried about me shooting with Tyson, did lots of pujas: Deverakonda
308.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has revealed that his mother was worried about him shooting with former American boxer Mike Tyson for the upcoming movie 'Liger'. "She did lots of pujas and put vibhuti (sacred ash) and kumkum (turmeric powder) on me before I left for the USA. I'm fine now and her pujas did really work," he added.

309.title: Don't know if I would be the ideal person to train a player: Nadal
309.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he isn't sure if he'd be the "ideal" person to train a tennis player. "I don't contemplate it, although, as the saying goes, never say I won't drink this water," added Nadal. Nadal had recently jokingly stated that he is "too expensive" following a query by Bulgarian tennis player Grigor Dimitrov, over becoming his coach after retirement.

310.title: Why is relief to elderly a 'burden' when MPs get train fare subsidy: Varun
310.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Friday criticised the Centre's decision to remove the concession given to senior citizens in train tickets, calling it "unfortunate". He questioned why the relief to the elderly is considered a "burden" when MPs continue to get subsidy on train fare. Earlier, the Railways Minister had told Parliament that granting concessions "weighs heavily" on the Railways.

311.title: Airlines can't deny boarding to disabled travellers without doctor's opinion: DGCA
311.article_body: Amending its regulations, the DGCA stated airlines cannot refuse boarding to any passenger on the basis of their disability. It added that if an airline is apprehensive about a disabled passenger’s health, it must consult a doctor regarding their boarding and if it denies boarding to them, it will have to inform the person and provide its reason in writing.

312.title: BJP will bring stars for friends but will make public yearn for pennies: Rahul
312.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised BJP for allegedly not giving senior citizens concession on railway tickets. "Government spent ₹911 crore on advertisements...₹1,45,000 crore/year on giving tax benefits to its industrialist friends. But can't spend ₹1,500 crore on rail concession," Rahul said. "[BJP] will even bring stars for friends but will make citizens yearn for pennies," he added.

313.title: No plan to extend July 31 deadline for filing income tax returns: Govt
313.article_body: The government is not considering extending the July 31, 2022, deadline for filing income tax returns, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Friday. "People thought the routine now is that dates will be extended...They were a little slow in filing the returns initially," he told PTI. However, Bajaj said that 15-18 lakh income tax returns are being filed per day.

314.title: 19th century stolen painting of Maharaja Serfoji II traced to US museum
314.article_body: The stolen painting of Maharaja Serfoji II has been traced to a museum in the US, Idol Wing of Tamil Nadu Police said on Friday. The painting was reportedly stolen from Saraswathi Mahal. It was purchased by US' Peabody Essex Museum in 2006 from art dealer Subhash Kapoor for $35,000. He was arrested in 2011 for trafficking stolen Indian antiques.

315.title: AAP's time has come, not scared of jails: Kejriwal on CBI probe recommendation
315.article_body: After L-G VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22, the Delhi Chief Minister said that AAP's time has come. "We are not scared of jails, not scared of the noose. They have made several cases against our people. The AAP has been growing since its win in Punjab...nothing will stop us," Kejriwal added.

316.title: Beacon of courage: Karan on Droupadi Murmu becoming President-elect
316.article_body: Bollywood celebrities have congratulated Droupadi Murmu on becoming the President-elect of India on social media. Karan Johar wrote, "A beacon of courage, resilience and inspiration." "Congratulations #DroupadiMurmu ma'am...Proud moment for the entire nation," Yami Gautam tweeted. Sunny Deol wrote, "Congratulations...Smt @DroupadiMurmu...you're an inspiring and a shining example of empowerment."

317.title: Election of Murmu bolstered people's trust in democracy: U'khand CM
317.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said election of tribal leader Droupadi Murmu as President of the country has bolstered people's trust in India's Constitution and democracy. "She represents a large section that had always been deprived, backward and at the end of society. That section is rejoicing," he added. Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India on Thursday.

318.title: Over 2,000 trains cancelled during Agnipath protests: Railways Minister
318.article_body: Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday informed the Parliament that 2,132 trains were cancelled between June 15 and June 23 during protests against the Centre's Agnipath defence recruitment scheme. Vaishnaw added that between June 14 and June 30, a total refund of approximately ₹102.96 crore was granted to passengers on account of the cancellation of trains.

319.title: People warned me about quitting 'Bhabi Ji...', but I don't regret it: Saumya
319.article_body: Actress Saumya Tandon said in an interview that she was warned about quitting 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai', in which she played the role of Anita Mishra. "Everyone told me...this was going to be very risky...But I thought it [was] risky to not take risks...I've never been scared or insecure," she added. Saumya further said she doesn't regret her decision.

320.title: Parents get worried about rumours linked to me, that bothers me: Kartik
320.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that initially rumours about him affected him. "I eventually learned not to pay attention to them. It's just that my parents get worried about these issues sometimes, and that bothers me...Rumours will come and go, and they eventually die down. No point in spending any time delving into them," he added.

321.title: I wouldn't term them as a big team: Smriti on CWG 2022 match vs Aus
321.article_body: Discussing the upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022 match between India Women and Australia Women, opener Smriti Mandhana said, "I wouldn't term Australia as a big team and make them feel good." Smriti added that the Indian team is aiming to win the gold medal. "I...got goosebumps when [javelin thrower] Neeraj Chopra got the gold [medal] at the Tokyo Olympics," she stated.

322.title: Kerala HC allows abortion to 13-yr-old girl impregnated by brother
322.article_body: Kerala High Court allowed a 13-year-old girl, who was impregnated by her minor brother, to get an abortion. During the hearing of the 30-week pregnant girl, the court said, "Easy availability of porn on the internet can mislead the juvenile minds of youngsters and give them wrong ideas." The authorities should review sexual education being imparted in schools, it added.

323.title: Pic shows astronauts' tracks on Moon 53 years after humans first landed on it
323.article_body: In order to commemorate 53 years of the Apollo 11 landing on the Moon, NASA recently shared a footage from the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter. It shows "the astronauts' tracks, still there after all this time," wrote NASA. It was the first time that humans had stepped on the surface of another world.

324.title: ISI MARK helmet saves life: B'luru IPS officer as biker survives crash in Brazil
324.article_body: Dr BR Ravikanthe Gowda, an IPS officer from Bengaluru, shared a video showing a biker surviving after coming under a bus. The video showed the biker's head, covered with a helmet, slamming into a tyre of the bus. "Good quality ISI MARK helmet saves life," Gowda tweeted. The accident reportedly took place in Brazil and the biker was largely uninjured.

325.title: Samantha & I have some of the best love stories onscreen: Naga Chaitanya
325.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya recently said in an interview that he and his ex-wife actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu have had some of the best love stories together onscreen. The actor was asked which actress he has the best onscreen chemistry with. Naga Chaitanya and Samantha got married in 2017 and announced their separation on social media in 2021.

326.title: Supreme Court dismisses plea to increase smoking age from 18 to 21
326.article_body: Supreme Court has dismissed a plea seeking to increase the smoking age from 18 to 21 and ban the sale of loose cigarettes near educational and healthcare institutions and places of worship. A public interest litigation (PIL) was filed by two advocates. "If you want publicity, argue a good case...don't file publicity interest litigation," SC said while dismissing the plea.

327.title: We know that feeling when Indian flag goes up: Smriti ahead of CWG
327.article_body: India women's vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has said that their team is "aiming for gold" at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, where women's cricket has been introduced for the first time. "We have watched the Commonwealth Games and Olympics and we know that feeling when the Indian flag goes up and when we hear the national anthem," Mandhana said.

328.title: Singapore carries out fifth execution since March
328.article_body: Singapore on Friday hanged a convicted drug trafficker, the fifth execution in the city-state since March. Nazeri bin Lajim was convicted in 2017 of possessing over 33 grams of heroin "for the purpose of trafficking". The list of those executed since March includes two Indian-origin men. Amnesty International has called on Singapore to "stop this relentless wave of hangings".

329.title: Family of 4 missing for over 1 month found dead in car in Punjab canal
329.article_body: The decomposed bodies of four members of a family were recovered from a car in the Sirhind Canal in Punjab's Faridkot on Friday. The family had been missing since June 11 after they went to Amritsar to visit the Golden Temple. The car was spotted by a passerby after it became visible as the water level in the canal receded.

330.title: Which regions have the highest and lowest CBSE Class 10 pass percentage?
330.article_body: CBSE on Friday declared results of Class 10 board exams, with the overall pass percentage being 94.40%. Trivandrum, which had the highest pass percentage of 98.83% in Class 12 exams, also topped in Class 10 with a pass percentage of 99.68%. Trivandrum is followed by Bengaluru (99.22%), Chennai (98.97%) and Ajmer (98.14%). Guwahati has the lowest pass percentage (82.23%).

331.title: New Zealand COVID death rate at record levels as it battles new wave
331.article_body: A record 151 people have died of COVID-19 in New Zealand in the seven days to July 16, Health Ministry data showed. This comes as the country battles new wave of COVID-19 infections fuelled by Omicron BA.5 sub-variant, which is particularly affecting the older population. In last 24 hours, 26 people died from COVID-19, all aged over 60, ministry said.

332.title: One-day cricket is dying a slow death: Usman Khawaja
332.article_body: Talking about ODI cricket following Ben Stokes' retirement from the same, Australia batter Usman Khawaja said he thinks one-day cricket is dying a slow death. He added that Test cricket is the pinnacle of the sport and T20I cricket is great entertainment and everyone loves it. He further said that ODI cricket is ranked third out of all three.

333.title: Centre trying to hinder AAP's work, they had been after Sisodia: AAP leader
333.article_body: After Delhi Lieutenant Governor (L-G) VK Saxena recommended a CBI investigation into Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj said that the Centre has been trying to hinder the work of the Arvind Kejriwal-led party. He added that they had been after Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia after Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest.

334.title: 4 held for killing friend for damaging iPhone during brawl in UP
334.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur Police arrested four people on Thursday for allegedly murdering their friend who accidentally damaged an iPhone of one of the accused during a brawl. A country-made pistol was used to kill the deceased, according to the district's SP. The incident took place on July 10. The accused were traced using surveillance and CCTV footage.

335.title: Hoist Tricolour or display it in your homes between 13th and 15th August: PM to people
335.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday tweeted, "This year, when we are marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, let us strengthen the Har Ghar Tiranga Movement. Hoist the Tricolour or display it in your homes between 13th and 15th August." "This movement will deepen our connect with the national flag," he wrote.

336.title: 51 couples get married in mass wedding ceremony in J&K's Srinagar
336.article_body: As many as 51 couples got married in a mass wedding ceremony in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar  on Thursday. The ceremony was organised by the NGO, 'We The Helping Hands Foundation'. The NGO's President said, "Many youths are not able to get married due to the dowry system and inflation...The motive was to help youth get married through simple ceremonies."

337.title: 3 soldiers killed in Israeli strikes near Damascus: Syrian state media
337.article_body: Three soldiers were killed and seven others were injured in an Israeli missile attack near Syria's Damascus on Friday, according to Syrian state media. A war monitor claimed that this was the 17th Israeli attack on Syrian territory this year. Notably, the Israeli military said that it does not comment on foreign reports.

338.title: Wouldn't like IPL to be a motivation in ODI series: WI batting coach
338.article_body: West Indies batting coach Monty Desai said he wouldn't want selection in the IPL to be a motivation for his players while playing the ODI series against India. "When you play an international game, your primary motive should be to represent your country in the best...way," added Monty. "We have encountered different layers of challenges [in ODIs]," he stated.

339.title: Hyderabad man arrested for allegedly molesting school children
339.article_body: A man in Hyderabad has been arrested for allegedly molesting students enrolled in his school. The accused, identified as Yasser, would reportedly lure children into a room by offering candies and molested them. He would also film the act. Parents had raised the issue with the school management, but when it refused to act against Yasser, they approached the police.

340.title: Mimi reacts to Ranveer's nude photoshoot, asks 'Would appreciation be same for a woman?'
340.article_body: Actress-politician Mimi Chakraborty, tweeting about Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, wrote, "Just wondering if the appreciation would have been same [for] a woman." "Or would you have...taken up morchas, given her...death threat and slut shamed her," she added. "We talk about equality where is that now??!!!!...It's your perspective that can change something or destroy it totally," Mimi wrote.

341.title: Google freezes hiring for 2 weeks to 'review headcount needs'
341.article_body: Google has announced that it will be freezing hiring for two weeks. In an email to the staff, Google's Senior Vice President Prabhakar Raghavan wrote, "We’ll use this time to review our headcount needs." This communication comes after the company recently announced that it would be slowing down its hiring process for the remaining year.

342.title: 39 deaths in Lonavala due to drowning since 2017; 29 in Bhushi Dam alone
342.article_body: At least 39 people lost their lives in Lonavala due to drowning, including 29 tourist deaths at Bhushi Dam, since 2017, as per data shared by police. "Despite warnings to tourists, they insist on climbing atop the rocks on the waterfall to click pictures. Most often, they choose to ignore our warnings, which leads to fatal accidents," an inspector said.

343.title: Mohammed Siraj, Umran Malik should be picked for T20 WC 2022: Gough
343.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-England pacer Darren Gough said, "I would [include] Umran Malik, Mohammed Siraj, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Jasprit Bumrah." "I have been impressed with Siraj when [I've seen] him bowl in Australia...Then you've got Umran...Anybody who bowls that speed gets into my squad...You might just need that extra...pace to shock the opposition," added Gough.

344.title: Opium worth ₹8 lakh seized in Delhi; 2 including MCD staff arrested
344.article_body: Police seized one kilogram of opium worth ₹8 lakh in Delhi's Dwarka and arrested two persons, including a 49-year-old permanent employee of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). One of the accused confessed to the crime and added that he used to cultivate opium in his field for medicinal purposes, but later began supplying it illegally.

345.title: 14-yr-old toys seller sleeping in Thane home dies as truck falls on her
345.article_body: A 14-year-old soft toys seller was killed while she was sleeping in her house along Mumbai-Nashik Highway after a truck fell on her on Friday morning. Reports said the girl was trapped under truck for over two hours. A crane was called to pull off the truck but she had died by then. Driver of truck ran away from spot.

346.title: Men hide ₹1.87 cr gold in undergarments & rectum, caught at Hyd airport
346.article_body: Air Intelligence Unit officials apprehended two male passengers at Hyderabad airport on Thursday for attempting to smuggle gold. The passengers, who had arrived from Dubai, had concealed 3.591-kg gold worth around ₹1.87 crore in undergarments and rectum. Officials also intercepted another passenger at Hyderabad airport for trying to smuggle 740-g gold by hiding it inside an exhaust fan and juicer.

347.title: 'The Ladykiller' has been intense, took break to get out of that space: Arjun
347.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said working on 'The Ladykiller' was a "mentally and emotionally" challenging experience for him. "The Ladykiller has been intense and raw for Bhumi (Pednekar) and I," he added. "That's why I went on holiday after that. I shot for about 45 days...and went away on a break...I needed to get out of that space," Arjun said.

348.title: Wasn't necessary: Dhanush on being called 'sexy Tamil friend' in Gray Man
348.article_body: Dhanush, during a press conference, answered a question about being referred to as a 'sexy Tamil friend' by Chris Evans' character in the Hollywood film 'The Gray Man'.
