He said it wasn't necessary but there was nothing wrong with it. "I think we were...adding more flavour and...it's absolutely fine...I'd appreciate if they...call us Indian actors, not North-South actors," Dhanush said.

349.title: Roofing firm organises pool party, barbecue for staff in UK on its hottest day ever
349.article_body: A UK-based company organised a pool party and barbecue in the building’s backyard on one of the hottest days of the year. Employees at HG Roofing Supplies also shared photos and videos from the pool party on social media. On Tuesday, the UK recorded its hottest day ever as the temperature crossed 40°C for the first time.

350.title: Sky over Australian town turns pink due to cannabis farm lighting, pics surface
350.article_body: The sky over Australian town of Mildura turned pink on Wednesday evening, with locals sharing pictures on social media and speculating the reason behind it. Pharmaceutical company Cann Group later confirmed that the lights were coming from its local cannabis farm, where the blackout blinds had been left open. "It was very bizarre," a local said.

351.title: Two girls score 500/500 marks in CBSE Class 12 exams
351.article_body: Yuvakshi Vig from Noida and Tanya Singh from Bulandshahr achieved a perfect score of 500/500 in their Class 12 CBSE exams. "I wasn't really expecting it. I had given all my attention to what I was doing and just hoped for the best possible outcome," Vig said. CBSE hasn't officially announced a country topper or toppers this year.

352.title: Most unique birds to go extinct in ongoing mass extinction: Study
352.article_body: Birds with the most unique physical features might go extinct in the ongoing mass extinction driven by climate crisis, a study warned. As per findings, these species with unique traits could be replaced with more widespread generalist species. Over 13% of the nearly 11,000 known bird species across the planet are threatened with extinction amid biodiversity crisis, the data stated.

353.title: It's been hard for me to watch England play well in Tests: Ponting
353.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said it has been hard for him to watch England play well in Tests. "I haven't [congratulated England Test coach Brendon McCullum]," added Ponting. England defeated India by seven wickets in the rescheduled fifth Test. Discussing 'Bazball', Ponting said, "When the real pressure of...Ashes...comes around, it'll be interesting to see if...[they] play...[this] way."

354.title: If we don't privatise Big Bash, then we might fall behind: Khawaja
354.article_body: Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja has suggested privatising the country's T20 tournament, Big Bash League, in order to make it competitive against other countries' T20 leagues. "There's a small window for the BBL to privatise in the next few years, and I'm afraid if we don't do that we'll fall behind...There are other tournaments starting up that are privatised," Khawaja said.

355.title: PFI’s political wing SDPI wins 3 municipal seats in MP's Neemuch
355.article_body: Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), a political wing of the Popular Front of India (PFI), has won three municipal seats in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch district. While SDPI's councillor candidates Arbina Bi and Jafar Shah won from wards 10 and 11 of Rampur municipality, defeating BJP candidates, Amna Bi won from ward 14 of Manasa, defeating a Congress candidate.

356.title: Traffic diversions on Bengaluru's Old Madras Road for white-topping work
356.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police has implemented traffic diversions on some routes of the city's Old Madras Road in view of the relaying of a key arterial road with white topping. The stretches between Kensington Oval Road junction and Anjaneya Temple junction on Old Madras Road have been temporarily closed from July 21 onwards.

357.title: Earned enough for 3-4 generations in Nehru, Indira, Sonia's name: Cong leader
357.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar said Congress leader Sonia Gandhi should be morally relieved. "Only then two meals we eat will be worthwhile. We have earned enough for next three-four generations in the name of Nehru, Indira and Sonia Gandhi. If we are not prepared for...small sacrifice today...rice we eat will rot and have worms in future," he added.

358.title: India's 3rd case of monkeypox confirmed in man who returned to Kerala from UAE
358.article_body: Country's third monkeypox has been confirmed in a 35-year-old man who returned to Malappuram from UAE on July 6th, Kerala Health Minister Veena George said. "He was admitted with fever at Manjeri Medical College Hospital on 13th and from 15th he began showing symptoms. His family and close contacts are under observation," George added.

359.title: 50-yr-old man found hanging in Mumbai's Shivaji Park area
359.article_body: A 50-year-old man was found hanging inside a residential building in Dadar's Shivaji Park area in Mumbai. According to the police, the deceased, identified as Trimurti Markar, was a Worli resident and worked as a driver in the Shivaji Park area. Notably, it appears that the deceased allegedly killed himself and an accidental death case has been registered, police said.

360.title: Russia about to run out of steam in Ukraine: UK spy chief
360.article_body: Russia is "about to run out of steam" in Ukraine, the head of Britain's intelligence service MI6 said.  "I think our assessment is that the Russians will increasingly find it difficult to supply manpower over the next few weeks. They will have to pause in some way and that will give Ukrainians opportunities to strike back," Richard Moore added.

361.title: Hypocrisy Zindabad: Jairam accuses Modi of destroying Khadi makers
361.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi tweeted on the anniversary of the tri-colour being adopted as India's National Flag, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised him by commenting, "Hypocrisy Zindabad". "From someone [Modi] who is destroying livelihoods of those who make [Khadi] national flags...From someone who was a pracharak in the organisation that took 52 years to hoist the National Flag," Ramesh tweeted.

362.title: CBSE declares Class 10 results
362.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) on Friday announced the Class 10 results. Students can access their results on https://cbseresults.nic.in. This year, over 21 lakh students appeared for CBSE Class 10 exams. Earlier today, CBSE declared Class 12 results, with 92.71% students passing the exams.

363.title: Bihar CM urges Railways Minister to rename station after local temple
363.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has written a letter to Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw urging him to rename Raghunathpur Railway Station in Buxar after Baba Brahmeshwar Nath temple, which is located in the same district. This comes as Kumar laid the foundation stone for the temple's beautification project on Thursday. Locals have been demanding the same for "several" years, Kumar said.

364.title: Pune civic body election office makes changes to 3.45 lakh voters
364.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) election office made changes to 3.45 lakh voters and published the final ward-wise voters' list on Thursday. "After receiving 4,273 objections...election office carried out site visits," an official said. "The maximum number of objections had to do with voters residing in one ward while their names had been added to adjacent wards," the official added.

365.title: School was running hostel without license: Official on Kallakurichi death
365.article_body: The Kallakurichi school where a student had died by suicide on July 13 was running hostel without a license, Saraswathi Rangasamy, the chairperson of the Tamil Nadu State Commission for Protection of Child Rights (TNCPCR), said. "This school hasn't taken any measures to apply for [the license] and it is a punishable offence," she added.

366.title: RBI has zero tolerance for rupee volatility & bumpy movements: Guv
366.article_body: As the Indian rupee touched new lows against the US dollar in the last few months, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "We have zero tolerance for volatile and bumpy movement of the rupee." He added that while the rupee is better placed than other currencies against the US dollar, the RBI continues to remain watchful of headwinds.

367.title: Struggled for 7 yrs, everybody who came after me was overtaking me: Sudeepa
367.article_body: Sharing his experience during his struggling days, actor Kichcha Sudeepa said, "It took me almost...seven years to give my first good film." "I [later went] through a low for almost six-seven years...everybody who came after me [was] overtaking [me]," added Sudeepa. "I lived on ₹500 per month...I used to work in a clothes store," he had earlier stated.

368.title: If BJP has courage, let ED put cameras while questioning Sonia: Baghel
368.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that if the Bharatiya Janata Party has courage, they should let the Enforcement Directorate to put cameras at the place where Congress leader Sonia Gandhi is being questioned in the National Herald case. "Do you have that kind of courage? The country wants to know where scam has taken place," Baghel added.

369.title: Work on Pune's Sus-Pashan bridge to be completed by end of August
369.article_body: The work on Pune's Sus-Pashan bridge has reached the final stage and will be completed by end of August, officials said. A PMC executive engineer said that the work on the last slab started on Thursday. "Due to...heavy rains, we can't continue tar laying work right now. Other works are going on with great speed," the PMC executive engineer added.

370.title: Man tries to stab US Congressman Zeldin during stump speech; held
370.article_body: US Congressman Lee Zeldin was attacked by a knife-wielding man on Thursday. Zeldin, the Republican candidate for New York Governor, was delivering a stump speech when a man climbed on stage "and attempted to stab" him. Zeldin said he grabbed the attacker's wrist and stopped him for a few moments before others tackled the man. The accused has been detained.

371.title: Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; list released
371.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura during July 22-24. Very heavy rainfall is expected over Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry, while extremely heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Gujarat.

372.title: Lower Oshiwara does not exist, change name of metro station: Residents
372.article_body: The residents of Lokhandwala have written to the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority demanding that the name Lower Oshiwara be changed. "There's no such place as Lower Oshiwara...moreover it'll...cause confusion...since next metro station on the same line is to be named Oshiwara," they said. "Hence, we request you to kindly change [its] name...to Lokhandwala," the residents added.

373.title: I have seen it 50 times: Ranbir on Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'Khalnayak'
373.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he has seen the 1993 film 'Khalnayak' which starred actors Sanjay Dutt and Madhuri Dixit Nene 50 times. "I was deeply impacted by 'Khalnayak'. It was the coolest film...coolest hero we'd ever seen on screen," added Ranbir. Discussing his favourite pan-Indian star, Ranbir mentioned actor Prabhas, who is known for acting in the 'Baahubali' film franchise.

374.title: Apple Watch helped detect a rare tumour in my heart, saved my life: US woman
374.article_body: A US woman claimed that Apple Watch saved her life after it warned that her heart was beating in an irregular pattern. Kim Durkee said she initially thought the warnings were false but her doctors confirmed that she had myxoma, a rare, fast-growing tumour. Doctors said the tumour was choking off her heart's blood supply and could've caused a stroke.

375.title: Anupam to play Jayaprakash Narayan in Kangana's 'Emergency', 1st look out
375.article_body: Anupam Kher has been roped in to portray political leader Jayaprakash Narayan in 'Emergency', an upcoming film which will feature Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. Anupam took to Instagram to share his look for the film and wrote, "Happy...to essay the role of the man who questioned fearlessly, a rebel in the truest sense of the word."

376.title: Mumbai lawyer gets 3-yr jail for molesting client's 16-yr-old daughter
376.article_body: A lawyer in Mumbai was sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment for molesting a client's 16-year-old daughter. He was helping the woman file an affidavit after she lost her crucial documents. He later offered the woman, who was living on rent, his neighbour's flat if she let him have physical relationship with her daughter and also touched her inappropriately.

377.title: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar, an SP ally, gets 'Y' security from UP govt
377.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has provided 'Y' category security to Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar. This comes after Rajbhar announced his support for NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the presidential election. Last month, Rajbhar had questioned SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's absence from campaigning for the Lok Sabha bypolls to Azamgarh and Rampur seats.

378.title: 8 arrested for offering namaz in public in Haridwar
378.article_body: Eight people were arrested for offering namaz at a weekly market in Haridwar, Uttarakhand. However, the accused were later granted bail by the sub-divisional magistrate's (SDM) court, police said. The accused were identified as Nizam (22), Nasim (52), Sajjad Ahmad (50), Mursalin (38), Ashraf (45), Asgar (37), Mustafa (35) and Ikram (47), and were arrested in Haridwar's Shivalik Nagar colony.

379.title: Johar denies favouring Janhvi on 'Koffee...', says 'Everybody read it wrong'
379.article_body: Karan Johar has responded to accusations of being biased towards Janhvi Kapoor and sidelining Sara Ali Khan on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "That's completely untrue," Johar said, adding, "I was...feeling bad because Janhvi lost both rounds. She lost...rapid fire round and...the game round. I was perhaps just trying to be nice. In that process, I think everybody read it wrong."

380.title: 10 paedophiles travelled to Poland after Ukraine invasion: UK
380.article_body: British paedophiles have been travelling to Poland claiming they're providing "humanitarian assistance" to refugees fleeing war in Ukraine, UK's National Crime Agency said. Ten known sex offenders have travelled to Poland in the six weeks following the war, it added. "All 10 were asked to leave following an interview with Polish immigration...and law enforcement," the agency further said.

381.title: We can be Vishwa Guru only when Population Control Bill is brought: BJP MP
381.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Kishan will introduce a private member's bill on population control in Parliament on Friday. "We can be Vishwa Guru only when the Population Control Bill is brought. [It is] very important to bring the population under control. With the way in which it's rising, we're heading towards an explosion," said the Gorakhpur MP.

382.title: Sonia Gandhi didn't tell ED to end questioning: Jairam Ramesh
382.article_body: "The allegations that ED stopped investigation as Sonia Gandhi requested to leave because she is suffering from COVID-19 are baseless," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh clarified after reports stating that Sonia asked ED officials to stop questioning her in the National Herald case surfaced. "The interrogation ended because ED didn't have anything to ask," he added.

383.title: Minister says ₹15 for corn is high in MP, adds 'it's free here'; shares video
383.article_body: Union Minister of State in the Ministry of Steel and Ministry of Rural Development, Faggan Singh Kulaste took to Twitter to share a video of his interaction with a corn seller in Madhya Pradesh. In the video, Kulaste can be seen telling the corn seller that ₹15 per corncob is "too high" and that "it is sold for free here".

384.title: Educational institutions closed in UP's Moradabad on July 25, 26 amid Kanwar Yatra
384.article_body: All educational institutions in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad will be closed on July 25 and July 26 keeping in view the annual Kanwar Yatra, the district administration said. Many pilgrims will be offering prayers at temples and to prevent traffic jams and rush during these days, all the educational institutions will remain closed on Monday and Tuesday, the official order reads.

385.title: BYJU's owes ₹86.21 crore to BCCI; Paytm wants to exit as title sponsor: Report
385.article_body: Indian cricket team’s jersey sponsor BYJU's allegedly owes ₹86.21 crore as dues to the BCCI, as per a report. It further said that Paytm has requested BCCI to assign their India Home Cricket title rights to Mastercard. While BCCI's agreement with BYJU's was extended till the 2023 ODI World Cup, its agreement with Paytm is valid till March 31, 2023.

386.title: Man swallows heroin capsules worth ₹8.86 crore, held at TN airport
386.article_body: Customs officials have seized heroin worth ₹8.86 crore at the airport in Tamil Nadu's Chennai and arrested a man, who is a Tanzanian national, in connection to this. The accused had swallowed 86 capsules containing 1.26 kg of the drug, which were extracted from him. According to a release, the accused arrived in Chennai from Uganda's Entebbe on July 14.

387.title: LG VK Saxena calls for CBI probe into Delhi government's excise policy
387.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. This comes after Delhi Chief Secretary filed a report showing prima facie violations of various policies. There were "deliberate and gross procedural lapses" made by Manish Sisodia. Delhi government allegedly extended "undue favours" to liquor licensees after tenders had been awarded.

388.title: You'll never see my house, I don't allow guests to click pics: Ranveer
388.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he doesn't allow guests to take pictures of his house. "You'll never see my house," added Ranveer. Talking about life, Ranveer stated, "Life is an agonising...journey. If I'm angry, I get really...angry...I get overwhelmed...[daily]." Having recently posed nude, Ranveer said, "In some...performances I've been...f**king naked...I can be naked in front of...thousand people."

389.title: BJP wants to tarnish the image of Gandhi family: Adhir Chowdhury
389.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate questioned Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday, party leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury alleged that BJP wants to tarnish the Gandhi family's image. "Will anybody...believe that the party that was in power for 54 years will commit a scam of ₹90 crore that too by...Sonia and Rahul Gandhi whose family members sacrificed their lives," Chowdhury asked.

390.title: 7-Eleven fires around 800 employees in US citing business restructuring
390.article_body: Convenience store chain 7-Eleven has fired about 800 people in the US citing business restructuring. The chain is owned by the Japanese retail conglomerate Seven & i Holdings. Last year in May, the 7-Eleven store chain completed the $21 billion acquisition of its rival Speedway convenience store chain from Marathon Petroleum.

391.title: Cristiano Ronaldo's agent Mendes offered him to Barca: Report
391.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's agent Jorge Mendes reportedly offered him to Barcelona before they signed Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski. Ronaldo was willing to accept a significant pay cut, the report added. Ronaldo is Real Madrid's all-time record goalscorer, having scored 451 goals in 438 matches, winning two LaLiga titles and four Champions League trophies. He currently represents Manchester United.

392.title: Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia steps back from leadership role after 14 years
392.article_body: Airbnb's Co-founder Joe Gebbia has announced that he will step back from his full-time operating role at the company. "The primary reason for this transition is that...my brain is bursting with more ideas to bring to the world," Gebbia said. Gebbia founded Airbnb with his roommate Brian Chesky as they were looking to raise money to afford their apartment's rent.

393.title: My life changed after my father said 'I can't pay your loans': Samantha
393.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu said she didn't have a choice but to act due to her family struggling financially. "My father said..., 'I can't pay your loans,' that changed my life," added Samantha. Discussing the worst thing read about herself, Samantha mentioned reading about her getting ₹250 crore in alimony following her divorce with actor Nagarjuna Akkineni's son Naga Chaitanya.

394.title: I'm doing great: US Prez Biden after testing positive for COVID-19
394.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he's "doing great" after testing positive for COVID-19. The 79-year-old, who's fully vaccinated and has twice received booster jabs, posted a video on Twitter, saying that he was "getting a lot of work done" and would continue with his duties. Biden will work in isolation until he tests negative, the White House said.

395.title: Truck hits girl as driver suffers heart attack in Punjab; driver dies
395.article_body: A truck hit a 14-year-old girl who was walking on the road in Punjab's Dhakoli on Thursday after the driver suffered a heart attack and lost control over the vehicle. The truck driver, who was declared dead at a hospital, was thrashed by onlookers who weren't aware of his medical emergency, police said. The girl was injured in the incident.

396.title: Video shows students kissing during 'truth and dare' game in K'taka; 1 student detained
396.article_body: A video of a boy and a girl, both students of a reputed Karnataka college kissing during a 'truth and dare' game has surfaced on social media. The boy who made the video has reportedly been detained for questioning. City police commissioner N Shashi Kumar said the incident had taken place six months ago at a private flat.

397.title: Will sit with photographers, they'll understand: Ranbir on attention after baby
397.article_body: While talking about media attention after his baby arrives, actor Ranbir Kapoor said that he will sit and have a conversation with the photographers. "I will sit down with them. They are lovely people, if you sit down with them and say something which means something to you, I think they will understand," he added.

398.title: Call me that, I don't care: Akshay on 'Canadian Kumar' tag
398.article_body: During the latest episode of 'Koffee With Karan Season 7', host Karan Johar asked Akshay Kumar if he gets trolled, to which the actor replied he doesn't go online much. "At...most, they write about Canada. Which I don't care," he added. When Karan pointed out that trolls call him 'Canada Kumar', Akshay said, "Yeah Canada Kumar. Okay, call me that."

399.title: Vedaant is getting a lot more attention than he actually deserves: Madhavan
399.article_body: R Madhavan has said his 16-year-old son, swimmer Vedaant, is getting a lot more attention than he actually deserves. Vedaant recently broke the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle swimming and won a gold medal at the Danish Open in April. "There are...better students than him in his age group in India...They need to be celebrated as well," Madhavan added.

400.title: African swine fever reported from 2 farms in Kerala's Wayanad
400.article_body: African swine fever has been reported among pigs from two farms at Mananthavady in Kerala's Wayanad, officials said. This comes after samples were tested at the National Institute of High Security Animal Diseases in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. "Now the test result has confirmed the infection. Directions have been issued to cull 300 pigs of the second farm," an official said.

401.title: 11 people arrested for selling foreign cigarettes illegally in Noida
401.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and the district tobacco control committee together arrested 11 people for selling packets of cigarettes of foreign brands in Noida. Six shops in Sector 18 and five shops in Sector 57-61 area were found possessing foreign-brand cigarettes which did not comply with the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA), police said.

402.title: At least 18 people killed in police raid in Rio de Janeiro
402.article_body: At least 18 people were killed during a raid in a dense warren of Rio de Janeiro slums on Thursday. Sixteen of the dead were alleged criminals, while a police officer and a bystander were the other victims, police said. The raid allegedly targeted a criminal group involved in cargo theft, bank robberies and was planning operations in rival slums.
